</413> <414> Is my bonus tax exempt? Bonuses earned in a Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE) area are tax exempt up to the maximum allowable amount. If you are enlisted, there is no maximum amount. If you are an officer, your maximum monthly exemption is limited to the highest rate of enlisted basic pay plus the amount of Hostile Fire Pay / Imminent Danger Pay (HFP/IDP) due to you for that month. Currently, that exemption is $7,834.50 monthly (CMSAF monthly basic pay of $7,609.50 plus amount of HFP/IDP payable during the month, not to exceed $225.00). Any amount in excess of that total will be taxed. If you are an officer, keep in mind that your normal basic pay also counts against your maximum exemption, as well as any bonus.
The career status bonus (CSB) is tax exempt only if the effective date of your election falls within a month when you are entitled to CZTE. CSB does not apply to Reserve.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 56 Sec 56D (Combat Zone Tax Exclusion) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437357000&usg=AFQjCNF_kATubIGfW6NN_oZ8KO-220Ei0w
Regulation (Reserve Only): AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 30.1.2 (Reserve Component: Federal Taxable Wages) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNGERTBA-33T-zZaz0lTCG2lv-KOgQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 (Withholding of Income Tax) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNFrMBbKuV8fltnXj_3zq7tNpLSKcw
Regulation (Active Duty Only): DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 66 (Career Status Bonus/Redux Election Option) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNFrMBbKuV8fltnXj_3zq7tNpLSKcw
</414> <415> How long will a debt collection take to post to my military and/or travel pay record? Military Pay Debts (Active Duty): You should see the collection posted to Leave and Earnings Statement (LES) within two pay periods of when you remitted the collection; this is due to military pay cut-offs.
Military Pay Debts (Reservist): You should see the collection posted to your LES within 30 days of when you remitted the collection; this is due to military pay cut-offs.
Travel Pay Debts (Active, Civilian and Reservist): Check Payment: If you mail a check to the AFFSC, then it should be posted to your Travel record within 30 days of mailing check.
Payroll Deduction (Active): If you elect payroll deduction to settle your travel debt, then the collection will start within two pay periods based on documentation submission to AFFSC. You will see a detailed debt transaction on your LES. Your travel record will record the individual collections as they are received. Payroll Deduction (Reservist): If you chose payroll deduction to settle your travel debt, then the debt will start to collect upon posting to your military pay record and a deduction will be made when you perform your next paid duty period. You will see a detailed debt transaction on your LES. Payroll Deduction (Civilian): You can pay your Civilian PCS travel debt back in installments by submitting a signed voluntary repayment statement through your servicing Civilian Pay Office Refer to DODFMR Vol 8 Chap 8 (Civilian Pay - Underpayments and Indebtedness) for additional information on civilian payroll deductions
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8A 8.16 (Debt Collection) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNGDqxd_0klBiFi_WiWeFzxDw_W29Q
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 32 (Reserve Component: Accounts Receivable - Debt Accounts) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNGERTBA-33T-zZaz0lTCG2lv-KOgQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 5 Chap 28 (Disbursing Policy - Installment Timing and Amount) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFNVD8LqZOpJfZVo0VF4E7KFpaPBA
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 8 Chap 8 (Civilian Pay - Underpayments and Indebtedness) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFNVD8LqZOpJfZVo0VF4E7KFpaPBA
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 69.6 (General Collection Guidance) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437358000&usg=AFQjCNHvGF37iz1_K7H3uNc5m30aVIjxsA
</415> <416> Why do I have an 'advance debt' amount on my Leave and Earnings Statement (LES)? The advance debt line on your LES is an amount given to offset the immediate collection of an overpayment. It is generated by the pay system when an entitlement/allowance is adjusted retroactively. The result is a debt you are required to repay; contact your servicing Finance Office for more details and debt repayment options. For Reservists, an advance debt is only applicable to long tours (30 days or more).
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 70 Sec 70A 70.3 (Overpayment of Pay and Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFGPdkxeZVI1Y4WaH_gcO0ikKuR4Q
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 70 Sec 70A 70.3 (Overpayment of Pay and Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFGPdkxeZVI1Y4WaH_gcO0ikKuR4Q
</416> <417> How do I contribute, and how much can I contribute, to the Savings Deposit Program (SDP)? You can make contributions at your deployed location by cash or check. In addition, active duty members can make deposits by allotment. Your deployed Finance Office will be able to assist with cash deposits or allotments to SDP. The maximum that you can contribute to SDP at one time is your un-allotted pay and allowances. Your un-allotted pay and allowances is the amount of money you are entitled to receive on payday minus your authorized deductions and allotments. Pay and allowances include special continuation pay, reenlistment bonuses, travel allowance on discharge and pay for unused accrued leave. You may combine pay accrued from one payday with pay accrued from the following payday to make one deposit as long as that deposit does not exceed what you are entitled to be paid for a one month period. NOTE: Although there is no limit on the amount you can contribute to SDP, only amounts up to $10,000 will accrue interest at a rate of 10 percent per year.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 51 Para 510101C (Savings Deposit Program - SDP - Unallotted Current Pay and Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFNVD8LqZOpJfZVo0VF4E7KFpaPBA
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 51 Para 5103 (Limitations on Amounts of Deposits) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFNVD8LqZOpJfZVo0VF4E7KFpaPBA
Related Link: DFAS Savings Deposit Program (SDP) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dfas.mil/dfas/militarymembers/payentitlements/sdp.html&sa=D&ust=1558682437359000&usg=AFQjCNFU8GHGW9yeqFuAbCzbt0SIkgRpAg
</417> <418> How many travel days do I get for Consecutive Overseas Tour (COT) / In Place Consecutive Overseas Tour (IPCOT)? Travel time is calculated identical to how PCS travel time is calculated, in accordance with JTR Chap 5 Part A (Uniformed Members - Permanent Duty Travel). Each leg of the journey is calculated independently with travel time allowed for each leg based on the mode(s) of travel used.

</418> <419> How much can I get advanced for PCS Travel? Normally, your Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) is required to be used for all PCS expenses. If you are exempt from GTCC use, you may get an advance for 100% of your estimated per diem, mileage, and dislocation allowance.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 Para 030501 (Use of the GTCC for official government travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437360000&usg=AFQjCNGytqZIesVGg44r1cqwVvrSMYll1w
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 Para 030501 (Use of the GTCC for official government travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437360000&usg=AFQjCNGytqZIesVGg44r1cqwVvrSMYll1w
</419> <420> Can I get Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) for my dependent(s) if I am living in the dorms? Your entitlement, if any, will depend on the circumstances. If you are living in the dorm and paying child support you may be entitled to receive BAH-Differential (DIFF) if the amount of child support you pay is equal to or greater than the BAH-Differential rate. BAH-Differential rates are in a table along with BAH transit and BAH partial rates. Follow the BAH Non-Locality Rates link to the Defense Travel Management Office (DTMO) website. In the Non-Locality BAH folder select the file for the current year's non-locality BAH rates. In other circumstances such as when you are on a dependent restricted tour (e.g. Osan AB) or assigned to a location where dependent travel is restricted (e.g. pipeline student), you will continue to draw BAH at the with dependent rate based on your authorized dependent's location. Follow the BAH Rates link to determine the amount of your BAH at the with dependent rate.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 26.2.7 (Family Separation Housing-B (FSH-B)) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437360000&usg=AFQjCNENfLPdJzEF-l8vNSkCyUcRIfLbeQ

</421> <422> When will I receive my disability severance / separation pay payment? Your final disability severance / separation pay payment will be included in your final pay upon separation or retirement. Normally, you will receive this payment via direct deposit on your date of separation or the next available business day. If your separation date falls on a weekend or holiday, then the payment date will be the first business day after your separation date.

</422> <423> When I PCS, does my state of legal residency automatically change? No, your state of legal residence does not automatically change when you PCS. To change your state of legal residence, please use eFinance. Reservists: To change your state of legal residence, please contact your servicing Finance Office.

</423> <424> How do I start Incentive Pays such as Parachute Duty (Jump Pay), Flight Deck Duty, Demolition Duty, Experimental Stress Duty, or other Incentive Pays? Please see below if you believe you are entitled to these incentive pays: Parachute Duty (Jump Pay) - Your Host Aviation Resource Management (HARM) Office will provide start and stop notification to your FSO Flight Deck Hazardous Duty Pay (FDHDP) - Your FSO prepares the start transaction based on special orders assigning a member to flight deck duty Demolition Duty - Your FSO processes transactions based on a letter prepared by your unit commander Experimental Stress Duty - Your FSO processes transactions based on assignment orders from your unit Other Incentive Pays - FSO processes transactions based on orders received from your unit
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 23 (Parachute Duty, Flight Deck Duty, Demolition Duty, Experimental Stress Duty and Other Incentive Pays) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437362000&usg=AFQjCNFGrT1BbHVM0MTD0oyLcRpLNnyrAA
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 23 (Parachute Duty, Flight Deck Duty, Demolition Duty, Experimental Stress Duty and Other Incentive Pays) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437363000&usg=AFQjCNGUTtBG_rEWzJksAZf7O4_0WBeUMg
</424> <425> Can the change to my state of legal residence be retroactive? The effective date for your change in legal residence will always be retroactive to the first calendar day of the month in which your DD Form 2058 (State of Legal Residence Certificate) is processed. Your effective date of change of legal residency cannot be effective prior to the current month and you can not have it back dated in order to receive a tax refund from your prior state of residence. Your state of legal residence at the time of entry into the Armed Forces remains the same until you make a change. You can designate or change a legal residence via eFinance. You may have a tax liability if you have not claimed state residency. Contact your state tax office for additional guidance.

Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 Para 440106B (State and Local Taxes - Legal Residence) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437363000&usg=AFQjCNHCxl9loc-qXs7Po1Wymr3oY96fzQ

</425> <426> How is my Dislocation Allowance (DLA) paid? DLA is paid via EFT to your direct deposit account, or you can charge up to your entitled DLA amount on your Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC). When possible, members should use their GTCC to cover their PCS expenses. To file a claim for DLA, please use eFinance. For Reservists, your orders must state that PCS entitlements are authorized.

</426> <427> Do I need to file a certain form for miscellaneous expense allowance? You will claim Miscellaneous Expense allowance on a DD Form 1351-2 (Travel Voucher or Sub Voucher).
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 10 Sec10B 10.16 (Civilian Employee PCS - Miscellaneous Expense Allowance) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437364000&usg=AFQjCNHIh6C0SjDSGrqOX0qnlG8vvDqjdw

</427> <428> Am I eligible for Family Separation Housing - Overseas housing allowance based location (FSH-O)? You are eligible for FSH-O if you are assigned to an unaccompanied tour to an OCONUS PDS. You may also receive Overseas Housing Allowance (OHA) for your dependents if they are authorized to stay at your losing OCONUS PDS or at a designated OCONUS area while you are assigned to an unaccompanied tour. Special authorization from the base commander is needed for stays at designated OCONUS areas. For Reservists, if you are called to active duty for more than 30 days you are entitled to FSH-O. You may also receive OHA for your dependents if they authorized to stay at your losing OCONUS PDS or at a designated OCONUS area while you are assigned to an unaccompanied OCONUS PDS. Special authorization from the base commander is needed for stays at designated locations.
Regulation: JTR Appendix K (Uniformed Members - Overseas Housing Allowance) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437365000&usg=AFQjCNF1WRFuAKfOF4mFvT2uBag4jUeYdA
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_EPara10414
</428> <429> How do I start and stop Hardship Duty Pay (HDP)? If you requested HDP to be started before you departed, you should see it in your Leave and Earning Statement (LES) within 30 days of your arrival. If you don't request it prior to departure, you can request it at the deployed Finance Office during your deployment. You can also wait until you return to your home station to file for HDP. Your settlement travel voucher is also used to stop the entitlement.
If you travel to different locations within the deployed Area of Responsibility (AOR) or between AORs, your HDP rate will be adjusted accordingly when you file your travel settlement voucher, but you can contact the deployed Finance Office if you want it adjusted prior to your return.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 18.4 (Hardship Duty Pay - Substantiating Documents) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437365000&usg=AFQjCNH8oDx8PQnpJBqdA9nh-Sa2lOfvAA
</429> <430> How many days am I authorized to travel for my civilian PCS? For private automobile use, one travel day is allowed for each 350 miles of official distance with an extra travel day for a remainder of 51 miles or more. Mileage is paid for the official distance that mileage is authorized. For common carrier use (e.g., airplane or bus), travel time is actual based on the most direct route. The current mileage rate can be located in the $JTR_Part_I_Para_2605.
Regulation: JTR Chap 2 Part I Para 2605 (MALT Rate) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437365000&usg=AFQjCNF1WRFuAKfOF4mFvT2uBag4jUeYdA
Regulation: JTR Chap 3 Part A Para 3025 (Travel-Transportation Policy - Travel Time) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437365000&usg=AFQjCNF1WRFuAKfOF4mFvT2uBag4jUeYdA
</430> <431> Can I set up my Family Separation Allowance (FSA) to begin before I depart on TDY, or do I have to wait until I return? If your TDY orders are for more than 30 days, you should go to your Finance Office before you depart to get FSA started. You will need to provide a copy of your orders and a DD Form 1561 (Statement to Substantiate Payment of Family Separation Allowance) to the Finance Office.
You will receive FSA in your paychecks after you have been separated from your dependents for over 30 days. However, the effective date of your FSA will be retroactive to the date you departed. You will continue to receive FSA until you return to your PDS and file your travel voucher provided your dependents do not reside at or near the TDY location nor visit for more than 30 days. To file a claim after completion of your TDY for FSA, please use eFinance.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270304 (FSA - Computation of Single or Multiple Periods of More Than 30 Days) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437365000&usg=AFQjCNFCe5KzoHgMdNcWiQpzQNUlSv92BA
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 27 Para 27.7 (FSA - FSO Action) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437366000&usg=AFQjCNEUx-zHjEaPPMY87taoHklWZ47jIQ

</431> <432> Why did I receive mileage for only one round trip when I commuted every day for my Annual Tour? When you are within the commuting area for your Annual Tour (AT), you are only authorized to receive mileage reimbursement for one round trip. To file your travel settlement voucher, please use eFinance.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 6.5 (Commuting Area Travel any Tour Less then 20 Weeks) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437366000&usg=AFQjCNF5kSWTzrMyga5AUt7XVUFuy6z1hQ
Regulation: JTR Chap 7 Part K Para 7355 (Uniformed Members - Reserve Component Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437366000&usg=AFQjCNFlLuLnm7RMA_klJl_2IYrwjN6kyA
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437367000&usg=AFQjCNEsJ0_dVxhju45JcbFxEhr3_PZo_A
</432> <433> What type of other reimbursable expenses can I be reimbursed for during my civilian PCS travel? Other reimbursable expenses such as parking fees at a terminal and pet quarantine fees (not pet transportation - covered in miscellaneous allowance) are reimbursable. A full list of allowable expenses for both TDY and PCS can be found in JTR Appendix G (Reimbursable and Non-Reimbursable Official Travel Expenses).
Regulation: JTR Appendix G (Reimbursable and Non-Reimbursable Official Travel Expenses) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437367000&usg=AFQjCNEiWJ4SnojoECCN13JEZ1GuQ689Nw
</433> <434> If I am in field conditions, does my Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) stop? No, COLA for your permanent duty station (PDS) remains in effect during all periods of TDY, including periods of field duty.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_9_Part_B_Para_9105
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_9_Part_B_Para_9105
</434> <435> How much Family Separation Allowance (FSA) will I receive for TDY? FSA is payable at the rate of $250.00 per month and prorated to $8.33 per day for partial months. To receive FSA II, type T (TDY), you must be TDY at least 31 consecutive days and your dependents cannot reside at or near the TDY location nor visit for more than 30 days.
For example, if you are TDY from 12 May 2007 to 24 June 2007, then you are eligible to receive FSA from the day you departed from your PDS to the day before you arrive back at your PDS. Your total days eligible to receive FSA would be 42 days (since FSA is computed on a 30 day month, the 31st of May is not eligible for payment).
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270103 B (Family Separation Allowance - Amount Payable) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437367000&usg=AFQjCNHiKIT66tciF9HcF-dNU_slT7uzSA
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270103 B (Family Separation Allowance - Amount Payable) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437367000&usg=AFQjCNHiKIT66tciF9HcF-dNU_slT7uzSA
</435> <436> Will I lose my Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) when I deploy? No, your COLA remains in effect, without change, during all periods of TDY, including periods of field duty or deployment, because COLA is paid based upon your PDS. If any of your dependents for whom COLA is based on will be out of the country for over 30 days, then you are required to report that information to your Finance Office.
To make changes to your COLA, please use eFinance.
Regulation: JTR Chap 9 Part B Para 9130 (Uniformed Members - COLA For A Member With Dependent) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437367000&usg=AFQjCNEiWJ4SnojoECCN13JEZ1GuQ689Nw
Related Links: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNFuQM4YUPE9MnnXUTG0DFSNnJhdrg
</436> <437> How often can I go on Recruiter Assistance leave? You can participate in the Recruiter Assistance Program (RAP) as often as your supervisor and commander approve your leave and eligibility, and the recruiters need assistance. Of course, mission needs will dictate supervisor and commander approval. If approved, you may receive up to 12 days permissive TDY (non-chargeable leave) to participate in the RAP. You can obtain more information about the RAP on the Air Force Portal.
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec G 14.10 (Recruiter Assistance Program (RAP)) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNFRdDY-S4y8cc5EJ9rbltBttkZmKQ
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 (Military Leave Program) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNFRdDY-S4y8cc5EJ9rbltBttkZmKQ
</437> <438> If I am legally separated from my spouse, do I get Family Separation Allowance (FSA)? No. If your sole dependent is your legally separated spouse, you are not entitled to FSA.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270201B (FSA - Dependents Separation Requirements - Sole Dependent) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNEyXXjGWCvTCsMfF6-tD1WS7iWJuQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270201B (FSA - Dependents Separation Requirements - Sole Dependent) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNEyXXjGWCvTCsMfF6-tD1WS7iWJuQ
</438> <439> I am a reservist; can I get a pay or housing advance? Yes, you can receive an advance pay for PCS and/or advance of housing allowances. The following criteria must be met to receive an advance: Members must have PCS orders or be in a PCS status of 20 weeks or more to be eligible for an advance of pay. You must accept a liquidation schedule which provides for repayment by termination date of orders or date of separation, whichever occurs first. Amounts of one month's basic pay less deductions or, if warranted and approved by your commander, an amount not more than three month's basic pay, less deductions, is authorized for advance pay. Submit your request for advance pay to be approved by your unit commander, then present a copy of your PCS orders and identification card to your local Finance Office.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 23.3.8 (Reserve Pay - Advance Paments) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437368000&usg=AFQjCNEBelnqL16FskkkL7_LRm7DDKRfZw
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 32 Para 3201 (Advance Payments) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437369000&usg=AFQjCNG1WGmEjB20vnwQG3UWzWW_XNVO5g
</439> <440> Do my dependents have to reside with me prior to my TDY to receive Family Separation Allowance (FSA)? No, your dependents do not have to reside with you, or in the vicinity of your permanent duty station for you to receive FSA-T (TDY). You are not authorized to receive FSA-T for your dependents when: The sole dependent is placed in an institution for a known period of over one year or for an indefinite period which may be expected to exceed one year. The sole dependent is a spouse legally separated or child(ren) in the legal custody of another person. The exception occurs when you have joint physical and legal custody of the child(ren) and the child(ren) would otherwise reside with you. Note: FSA-T is only authorized for a TDY exceeding 30 days, provided your dependents do not reside at or near the TDY station nor visit for more than 30 days. To file for FSA, please use eFinance.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270103 A3 (Family Separation Allowance - Temporary (FSA-T))When Payable) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437369000&usg=AFQjCNG1WGmEjB20vnwQG3UWzWW_XNVO5g
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270201 (FSA - Dependents Separation Requirements) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437369000&usg=AFQjCNG1WGmEjB20vnwQG3UWzWW_XNVO5g
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Table 27-1 (FSA - Conditions of Entitlement) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437369000&usg=AFQjCNG1WGmEjB20vnwQG3UWzWW_XNVO5g
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437369000&usg=AFQjCNGhei7Ib-19syhDLzHW_fwPgJ2kCA
</440> <441> Will I be reimbursed for hotel stays while traveling to my new PDS? This will depend on the mode of travel. Generally speaking, lodging is not reimbursed while traveling by Privately Owned Vehicle (POV). However, you do receive what is known as Monetary Allowance in Lieu of Transportation (MALT Plus), which is a flat rate allowance and mileage. $JFTR_Chap_5_Part_A_Para_5026 has more information on MALT Plus. For air travel, lodging is entitled based on the hotel's single room rate, at the ports in and out of a CONUS/OCONUS location. For ferry travel, you are authorized to lodging at the ports on and off of the ferry. MALT Plus is also payable for the driving portions to and from the ferry ports.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_5_Part_A_Para_5026
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_5_Part_A_Para_5034
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_5_Part_B_Para_5520
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_5_Part_A_Para_5032
</441> <442> What rate will I get for meals and lodging on a formal training TDY? If your lodging is on base, the training location commander, not your Approving Official (AO), decides which meal rate will be paid based on government mess availability. You will also be reimbursed for actual lodging cost. If you were authorized to lodge off base, you will receive the full per diem rate for meals, and will be reimbursed your actual lodging cost not to exceed the max lodging rate. The per diem rates for lodging and meals vary by location. The available link Per Diem Rates will take you to the per diem rates for CONUS and OCONUS. To file your settlement travel voucher, please use eFinance.
Regulation: JTR Chap 4 Part B Para 4200D (Combatant Command (COCOM), Joint Task Force (JTF) AOR, and Schoolhouse Training (Formal Courses of Instruction)) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437370000&usg=AFQjCNEd-AITTGuU86NMXrvjJ5dMxZp1aA

</442> <443> Am I entitled to Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) while occupying government quarters? Generally, you are not entitled to receive BAH (or Overseas Housing Allowance - OHA) while occupying permanent government family-type (i.e. base housing) or single-type (i.e. dormitory) housing. You may be entitled to BAH if your dependents do not occupy family-type government quarters or you are living in privatized government housing. To avoid a potential overpayment, please contact your servicing Finance Office if you have been assigned permanent government quarters and your BAH or OHA has not yet stopped.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 26.5.1.2 (Housing Management Office - HMO) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437370000&usg=AFQjCNGCT-qf4urLZlJl4OtalR_-RHjWDQ
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_D_Para_10300
</443> <444> Do I get reimbursed for driving two vehicles to the Vehicle Processing Center (VPC)? No, each eligible member/employee is limited to reimbursement for driving one vehicle to/from the VPC.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_5_Sect_6_Para_5334
Regulation: $JTR_Vol_2_Sect_6B_Para_5706
</444> <445> Are Cadets eligible to receive Basic Allowance for Subsistence (BAS)? Eligibility varies, please contact the Academy Finance Office for specific details.

</445> <446> What is Dislocation Allowance (DLA)? DLA is an allowance that is intended to help offset the cost of moving your household from one location to another in connection with a PCS or other government funded move. DLA is a flat amount based on your rank and dependency status, and can be used for any purpose. No justification or receipts are required. Current rates are available at the link below. To file a settlement voucher to claim DLA, please use PCS In-Processing System (PIPS).

</446> <447> How and when is the mileage going to be paid for my Privately Owned Vehicle (POV) pick up/drop off? If you are picking up/dropping off your vehicle in conjunction with the PCS, then you will be reimbursed when you file your PCS settlement voucher at your new PDS. If it is not concurrent with the PCS, then you may submit a voucher at your Finance Office.

</447> <448> How do I request a base pay or housing allowance advance? For base pay / military pay advances, you must have PCS orders or be deployed for more than 365 days to an area subject to hostile fire/imminent danger pay. To submit a request for advance pay please use eFinance. For basic allowance for housing (BAH) or overseas housing allowance (OHA) advances, you must have a copy of your lease, rental agreement or substantiating documentation to justify the amount of the advance. Additionally, an AF Form 1039 (which you can complete using eFinance) must accompany this documentation. You will need your commander's signature. Submit all documents and completed forms to your servicing Finance Office.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 26.29 (Advance Payment of BAH) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437372000&usg=AFQjCNFagkZFP48OJ90WmjFuBNQ9S-wXlA

Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_APara10028

</448> <449> How often does my Family Separation Housing - Overseas housing allowance based location (FSH-O) change? Your FSH-O rate can change as frequently as twice a month as a result of fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates. FSH-O rates are equivalent to the without dependent rate overseas housing allowance (OHA) for your duty location. OHA changes whenever there is a change in your location's adequate lodging costs, a change in your housing expenses, or a change in the your pay grade. There is no set schedule for these changes. Note, FSH-O stop on the day your lease terminates if prior to the day before your PCS departure.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 26.2.6 (Family Separation Housing-Overseas (FSH-O)) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437373000&usg=AFQjCNGK_-IZF9w1FmmAu-NcxitH3qjrLA
Regulation: JTR Chap 10 Part A Para 10002 (Uniformed Members - Housing Allowance) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437373000&usg=AFQjCNF9_sSQeMdeOc3vUyZR6xBTM8gc-g
</449> <450> I arrived PCS on a holiday weekend and could not sign in. Will I be charged leave for the weekend and holiday? Your sign in date to your new PDS will be determined by the day you notify your unit of your availability for duty. Leave will be calculated based on your departure date from your old PDS and your sign in date to your new PDS minus allowable travel time. Examples: Member arrives at Peterson AFB, CO on Friday and checks into billeting and calls his/her supervisor. Member reports to duty section Monday morning. Sign in date is Friday. Member arrives at F.E. Warren AFB, WY on Friday and checks into billeting. Member does not contact his/her supervisor and reports to duty on Monday morning. Sign in date is Monday. Be sure to contact your new Unit as soon as you arrive in the local area, even if it is a non-duty day, to avoid being charged any extra days of leave.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 5 Sec 5A 5.8 (Leave) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437373000&usg=AFQjCNGHt46saQwAZsppJJUslArdAnkqGA
Related Link: Military PCS Calculator https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/gcss-af/USAF/AFP40/d/sA1FBF31D23D21F6B0123ED377B730575/Files/Calculators/Military_PCS_Calculator.htm&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNEVQBlGDXDZlKz5WgcFZZR4zbCNFw
Related Link: PCS In-Processing System (PIPS) https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNH4FZ8LoUbApvKeAQXzwyimLx75Fg
</450> <451> My spouse and I are dual military, are we both authorized to Temporary Lodging Expense (TLE)? Yes, you are both authorized to receive reimbursement. Please note the following when filing for your TLE reimbursement: Each member is authorized TLE whether or not temporary lodgings are jointly or separately occupied Each member may be reimbursed up to $290/day One member may not claim the other member for TLE payment Both members may not claim the same dependents, on the same days, for TLE purposes Each member must certify that temporary lodging was occupied for the number of days for which TLE is claimed Further guidance in filing for your TLE reimbursement is available when in-processing with your new Finance Office.
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5434 (Uniformed Members - Temporary Lodging - CONUS Temporary Lodging Expense - TLE) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNH-MuTbE4oLaEqtRS5aBaNeLryLDA
Related Link: TLE Calculator https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/gcss-af/USAF/AFP40/d/sA1FBF31D23D21F6B0123ED377B730575/Files/TLE_Calculator.htm&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNFNn7YmMQbsV38C79MUjUn04HHFig
</451> <452> If I am retiring or separating, can I file my voucher at any base? No, your separation/retirement voucher must be processed by the Finance Office in which you separated/retired from. Be sure to get their mailing address prior to departing.
If you are having a port separation/retirement, you will file your voucher at the CONUS base that is processing your port separation/retirement.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 5 Sec 5A 5.6 (Separation/Retirement from the Service or Relief from Active Duty) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNEn6SMRvuPNEa1ggbN_bDoFPjhcFA
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8A 8.26 (Retirement/Separation) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNEn6SMRvuPNEa1ggbN_bDoFPjhcFA
</452> <453> Can I start Hostile Fire Pay/Imminent Danger Pay (HFP/IDP) before I deploy? If you contact your Finance Office and provide them with a copy of your orders, they can start your HFP/IDP effective on the projected date of your arrival in the designated area. This date may need to be adjusted when you return and file your travel settlement voucher. Alternatively, if you're deploying to an AOR such as Afghanistan, the information gathered when you arrive in country will be used to start your HFP/IDP.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 13.2 (HFP & IDP - Sources of Input) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437374000&usg=AFQjCNEba151WS91uqNgFhWv5Lse4gk4Jg
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 10 Para 1001 (Special Pay - Entitlement Provisions) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNG4DzjpC01H8n3V-5ToZx1ZUzJrbg
</453> <454> What types of pay are eligible for contribution to my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP)? You may choose to contribute up to 100% of your special or incentive pays and bonuses. However, you must be actively contributing from your basic pay in order to contribute from any other types of pay or bonus.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 68.7 (Uniformed Services Thrift Savings Plan - Contributions) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNHNd2eRuBs9vS3TjoKetRBM-Df6dw
Regulation (Reserve Only): AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 50.7.2 (Reserve Component:) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNEJp4CS2MsYCiXS8XYDaPuJDWTnNQ
</454> <455> Why didn't I receive my Hostile Fire Pay/Imminent Danger Pay (HFP/IDP)? There could be several reasons why you did not receive your HFP/IDP. If you are concerned that it isn't reflected in your paycheck, first make sure you have allowed for sufficient processing time (usually two pay periods). Your HFP/IDP can be started before you leave for your deployment, during your deployment, or paid upon your return. In all three cases, it is posted to your pay account based on a copy of your orders or settled travel voucher. Once the HFP/IDP is posted, it will apply to your next regular paycheck. This may take a couple of pay periods to show up due to payroll cut-off dates.
If you waited until your return, please allow five business days for your voucher to process and another 30 days (or two pay periods) for HFP/IDP to reflect in your paycheck. If you still have questions you will need to contact your servicing Finance Office.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 13.3.2 (IDP can be reported on an AF Form 1881 or...) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNHNd2eRuBs9vS3TjoKetRBM-Df6dw
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 10 Para 1001 (Special Pay - Entitlement Provisions) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNG4DzjpC01H8n3V-5ToZx1ZUzJrbg
</455> <456> Does Hardship Duty Pay (HDP) vary by location? Yes, Hardship Duty Pay - Location (HDP-L) varies by location and is payable at either $50, $100, or $150 per month. Approved designated areas and rates can be found in DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 17 Figure 17-1 (Hardship Duty Location Pay Areas).
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 17 (Special Pay - Hardship Duty) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNG4DzjpC01H8n3V-5ToZx1ZUzJrbg
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 17 Figure 17-1 (Hardship Duty Location Pay Areas) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437375000&usg=AFQjCNG4DzjpC01H8n3V-5ToZx1ZUzJrbg
</456> <457> As a Reservist, how does Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) work when I move into privatized housing? You will receive your standard BAH rate (determined by your rank, location and dependency status) while occupying privatized housing. As a Reservist you cannot set up an allotment, so you are required to make arrangements with the Housing Office to pay your rent at the rate of your BAH minus 110% of the approved average utility calculation. You will receive BAH for any tour over 30 days (PCS or TDY) regardless of whether or not you are in privatized housing.
Depending on your personal utility consumption, your total monthly expenses (rent and utilities) may or may not exceed your BAH.
Related Link: $AFCEE_Privatized_Housing_Website
</457> <458> Do I have to stay in the local area for convalescent leave? You do not have to stay in the local area for convalescent leave. Departure from the local area is at the discretion of the medical authority or attending physician most familiar with your condition.
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec C 6.4.3.2 (Depart local area while on convalescent leave) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437376000&usg=AFQjCNEN_X3-LRZwlooqkS92ylx9_hgnNA
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec C 6.4.3.2 (Depart local area while on convalescent leave) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437376000&usg=AFQjCNEN_X3-LRZwlooqkS92ylx9_hgnNA
</458> <459> How much will I earn on my Savings Deposit Program (SDP) contribution(s), and for how long? If your amount on deposit is less than $10,000, interest at the rate of 10 percent per year is compounded quarterly. Once $10,000 is on deposit, simple interest is computed on the $10,000 only. No interest is paid on amounts exceeding $10,000, except on amounts for a member who is in a missing status. Your deposits stop accruing interest 90 days after your eligibility to make SDP deposits terminates (i.e. when you leave the authorized SDP contribution area). If no withdrawal is made within 120 days, DFAS will automatically transfer the funds to your military pay account.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 51 Para 5104 (Interest on Deposits) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437376000&usg=AFQjCNGNE4ourENcyUywXjvsvd1uawSo8g
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 51 Para 510602 (Ninety-Day Limitation Period After Eligibility to Make Deposits Terminates) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437376000&usg=AFQjCNGNE4ourENcyUywXjvsvd1uawSo8g

</459> <460> As a Reservist, how often can I receive military clothing allowance? For Enlisted Reservists: Generally, items of individual clothing required by Reserve Component personnel on Active Duty for periods of less than six months or while on Inactive Duty, are furnished as in kind issues. However, the prescribed cash portion of the standard initial clothing allowance may be paid at the time that your initial allowance is issued for items designated to be personally purchased and not issued in kind. Reserve Officer: A Reserve Officer is entitled to one initial military clothing allowance upon completion of 14 days of active duty or 14 inactive duty periods. Officers who are on orders for more than 90 days may be authorized to additional Officer uniform allowance. This allowance is not payable when the tour of duty for which payment is being considered began within 2 years after the end of a previous period of active duty, or active duty for training, of more than 90 days. This applies whether or not a uniform allowance was paid for the previous tour of duty.

</462> <463> When will my housing allowance change to reflect my new duty location? Generally, for members with dependents, if you are assigned to a base in the CONUS, Alaska or Hawaii, your entitlement to basic allowance for housing (BAH) for your PDS location is effective on the day you arrive at your base. If you are assigned to an overseas station, you must first obtain a rental or lease agreement after arrival before you are entitled to be paid overseas housing allowance (OHA). Of course, if you're assigned to family housing, you will not receive a housing allowance.

</467> <468> As a Reservist, how much special medical pay am I entitled to during an Active Duty tour that is 30 days or more? Special medical pay depends upon the type and length of your active duty tour. If you are on active duty for training, annual training, or school training for less than one year, you will receive special medical pay per the following: Medical Officers - $450 per month, prorated on a daily basis Dental Officers - $350 per month, prorated on a daily basis Veterinarians & Optometrists - you are not entitled to medical special pay If you are on active duty for any reason other than training for more than 30 days, you will receive special medical pay per the following: Medical & Dental Officers - you will receive full special medical pay. The amounts payable vary by specialty, and can be found in the DFAS Military Pay Tables Veterinarians & Optometrists - $100 per month, prorated on a daily basis

</473> <474> What travel and transportation allowances am I entitled to while serving an Indeterminate TDY (ITDY)? Please note, for 365-day extended deployments, with return to your PDS, the following ITDY entitlements do not apply. En route to the ITDY location or prior to departure to the ITDY location: You are entitled to dependent travel and transportation at government expense to an alternate place to establish a permanent residence during your ITDY. You are also entitled to PCS travel and transportation allowances for your travel to accompany your dependents to the alternate place, only if your presence is needed to assist your dependents in relocating (not for personal convenience). Your entitlement is authorized for either: 1) en route to your ITDY location, or 2) a separate round trip between your Permanent Duty Station (PDS) and the alternate place. Upon completion of your ITDY assignment: You are entitled to dependent travel and transportation at government expense from an alternate place to a new PDS, or the old PDS, as applicable. Reimbursement for your travel and transportation is authorized from the ITDY location to the old PDS to accompany your dependents (if dependents elected to remain in place at old PDS) en route to the new PDS, if applicable. Reimbursement for your travel and transportation is authorized from the ITDY location via the alternate place to assist with your dependents travel to the new PDS, or to the old PDS, as applicable. Dislocation Allowance (DLA) is also payable, provided you relocate your dependents to establish a permanent residence in conjunction with your ITDY assignment.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_4_Part_I_4900
</474> <475> How do I submit my TDY voucher? If your TDY orders are in Defense Travel System (DTS), then you will file your settlement in DTS. In all other cases, you will need to prepare a DD Form 1351-2 and submit through eFinance.

Access the AF Form 2282 here via e-Publishing: e-Publishing. All three of the signatures (traveler, (deployed) squadron commander, and approving official) listed on the AF Form 2282 are required. </478> <479> When is the Finance Office at the USAFA open? The USAFA Finance Office is open Monday to Friday from 9 AM to 3 PM. You can also call the Finance Office at DSN 333-6982 / 6994 or Commercial (719)333-6982 / 6994.

</479> <480> What receipts do I need to submit with my TDY voucher? When submitting a TDY voucher, you need to submit receipts for lodging, regardless of the amount, and receipts for any other expense of $75.00 or more. For registration fees, an itemized receipt or statement indicating the meals and lodging that were provided to you is required if the order does not specify this information. If a required receipt is lost or otherwise unobtainable, you must submit a Lost Receipt Form (found in eFinance) including a statement explaining the circumstances. Click here to access eFinance: eFinance. Note: Include (or upload) a copy of your airline receipt for both DTS and non-DTS travel claims, even if you made your reservations through DTS.

</480> <481> How long does it take for my voucher to be paid? Generally, for non-Defense Travel System (DTS) vouchers, your travel voucher will be paid within ten working days from the day you file with your servicing Finance Office. You will receive an e-mail copy of your settlement after your TDY voucher has been paid. During the peak PCS season (Jun-Oct), you may experience greater delays due to the volume of vouchers being processed.
noref
noref
noref
</481> <482> How does the advance pay process/request work? Advance pay is intended to assist with out-of-pocket expenses that exceed or precede reimbursements incurred in a duty location change, and are expenses that are not typical of day-to-day military living. Advance pay is only authorized in the event of a PCS move or a deployment for more than 365 days to an area subject to hostile fire/imminent danger pay. PCS moves from OCONUS to CONUS for the purpose of separation or retirement are not authorized PCS advance pay. The amount of advance pay that you may receive is limited to a maximum amount of three month's basic pay less deductions. Advance pay, once approved, will be electronically deposited into your bank account. Requests for advance pay are documented on a DD Form 2560 (Advance Pay Certification/Authorization Form). Your unit Commander is the approval authority for advance pay in the following circumstances: You are in pay grades E-1 through E-3 regardless of amount or repayment schedule. You are in a pay grade of E-4 or higher and: Amount requested is more than one month's base pay less deductions Repayment is requested for more than 12 months Payment is requested between 30 and 90 days of PCS departure or 60 to 180 days after PCS arrival Normally, it is only under extenuating circumstances that a commander will approve you to receive your advance 90 days prior to, or within 180 days after you PCS In all other circumstances your signature is all that is required Bring your completed DD Form 2560 (Advance Pay Certification/Authorization Form), along with a copy of your PCS orders, to your local Finance Office. When requesting an overseas housing allowance (OHA), it must be approved by the unit commander and the housing officer. You must show proof of expenses before you can receive a housing advance to include copy of your lease, utility statements, and any other pertinent documentation. Normally, an advance housing allowance may not be paid more than three workdays prior to you being required to make a payment under a lease or payment plan. Repayment will typically be made within 12 months, beginning in the month after receipt of the advance. For example, if you receive a $1,200 advance pay in June, the repayment will begin in July. In this example your repayment amount would $100 per month ($1,200 divided by 12 months equals $100 per month), or $50 per pay period if you get paid twice per month. Alternatively, you may use eFinance to submit your advance pay request electronically.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 35 (PCS Advance Payments) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437386000&usg=AFQjCNEzPDaxaQ4BnVBiueDacUei_pKGwg
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 2 Part 2 Chap 6 Sec 6F 6.31 (PCS Advance Pay) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v2/afman65-116v2.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437386000&usg=AFQjCNEqDHmGrVjfdALZG5tEDFR3iUYFaA

</482> <483> Do I receive anything other than base pay for Reserve Funeral Honors Duty Allowance (FHDA)? When you perform funeral honors duty for a minimum of two hours, you are entitled to either $50 or one day of basic pay for your grade and years of service. You can only be paid one Funeral Honors Duty Allowance (FHDA) per calendar day. Federal and state income tax, if applicable, is withheld from your entitlement. With the exception of expenses reimbursed for travel and transportation, FHDA is the only monetary compensation authorized to be paid.

</483> <484> How do I request an earnings statement for my employer? Visit your Finance Office to request an earnings statement. You can also access myPay to obtain your Leave and Earnings Statements (LES).

</484> <485> Am I eligible to receive miscellaneous expense allowance? You are authorized to receive Miscellaneous Expense allowance when the following four requirements are met: A Permanent Change of Station/Temporary Change of Station is authorized / approved. An appropriate service agreement is signed. You move out of your old residence. You establish a new temporary or permanent residence.
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part B Para 5816 (Civilian Employees - Miscellaneous Expense Allowance - MEA - Eligibility) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437387000&usg=AFQjCNF2LtHSCasZnJwCTZHx_P6C--U5DQ
</485> <486> How many days of Temporary Lodging Expense (TLE) are authorized? If you are moving CONUS to CONUS or from OCONUS to CONUS, then you are authorized ten days of TLE. The ten days can be split between the old and new CONUS Duty Stations as he/she prefers. If you are moving from CONUS to OCONUS, then you are authorized five days of TLE. The five days can be mixed between the old Duty Station and the designated location for your dependents, if applicable.

</486> <487> Am I allowed move-in housing allowance (MIHA)? MIHA is intended to defray the move-in housing costs associated with occupying privately leased private sector housing. If you are authorized overseas housing allowance (OHA), you are entitled to MIHA/Miscellaneous. MIHA/Miscellaneous rates can be found at OHA Rates. MIHA/Rent - covers reasonable rent-related expenses (fixed, one-time, non refundable charges levied on behalf of the landlord or foreign government that you must pay before/upon occupying a dwelling). MIHA/Rent must be claimed on a DD Form 2556 (Move-In Housing Allowance Claim) and submitted to your servicing Housing Office. MIHA/Security - covers reasonable security-related expenses if you are assigned to an area in which your home must be modified to minimize terrorist and/or criminal threat. This allowance is payable only for certain areas, see $JTR_Appendix_N_Part_2.

</487> <488> How soon can I apply for advance pay and when will I receive it? You can request advance pay no earlier than 30 days prior to final out-processing at your old PDS or up to 60 days after arrival at your new PDS. With your commander's approval, you can request advance pay from 31-90 days prior to your out-processing at your old PDS or 61-180 days after arrival at your new PDS. You should receive your payment within 3-5 business days after processing. To apply for advance pay, please use eFinance.

</488> <489> What are my debt repayment options? Active Duty: You can repay your debt in lump sum cash, by check, or through payroll deduction. Contact your Finance Office to make payment.
Reserve: Reserve members assigned to an organization with a Reserve disbursing function may pay via check payable to US Treasury - DSSN 3801. Reserve members not co-located with a Reserve disbursing function mail their checks to DFAS at the following address. This address is effective 1 August 2008.
Disbursing Operations Directorate 3801 Center Collections PO Box 269490 Indianapolis, IN 46249
Travel Debts: You may pay travel debts by check or via payroll deduction. Make checks payable to:
DSSN 3801
and mail to: Air Force Financial Services Center, 2700 Doolittle Dr. Suite 113, Ellsworth AFB, SD 57706.
Contact your Finance Office to repay your travel debt by payroll deduction.

</489> <490> Am I entitled to an enlisted initial clothing allowance? You are entitled to an enlisted initial clothing allowance if this is your first enlistment in the service, or if you reenlisted in the same branch of service and more than three months have passed since your date of discharge/release from Active Duty. You may also be entitled to the enlisted initial clothing allowance if you enlist in a branch of service other than the one from which you were discharged. Reservists - Enlisted initial clothing is issued in kind. As a Reservist, you are not authorized an initial clothing allowance when brought to active duty on a statutory tour; uniforms will be issued by your unit prior to starting your statutory tour.

</491> <492> What am I authorized for my dependents during a civilian PCS? If your dependents travel with you, then any dependent 12 or over receives 75% of your allowance and dependents under 12 receive 50%. If your spouse/domestic partner travels independently of you, then they are entitled to per diem equal to what you are authorized. All other dependents will get per diem based on 75% of your per diem rate if they age 12 years or older, or 50% if they are younger than 12. No travel or per diem allowances are authorized for your dependents at a TDY location en route to your new permanent duty station (PDS).
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part B (Civilian Employees - Permanent Duty Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437390000&usg=AFQjCNEpaTto6lsYc89kfaBHC-Rbi_8AcA
</492> <493> How do I apply for Overseas Housing Allowance (OHA)? To apply for OHA, you must complete a DD Form 2367 (Individual OHA Report) and submit the completed form, together with a copy of your lease agreement and PCS orders, to your base housing office for approval. The base housing office (or the appropriate official) will then forward the approved documents to the finance office for processing.

</493> <494> If I choose to move to a different home within the area, am I authorized to receive any type of move-in housing allowance (MIHA)? No, there is no allowance to a second MIHA in situations where you move within the same local area. There are some exceptions if your move is Government funded or required by the Government.

</494> <495> Why does my lodging receipt have to be itemized? Lodging receipts must be itemized because the Finance Office / Approving Official (AO) must ensure the daily lodging reimbursement includes only the actual cost of the room and taxes. Other hotel related expenses may be claimed and authorized / approved as a separate reimbursement. To file your settlement travel voucher, please use Defense Travel System (DTS). To file your non-DTS settlement travel voucher, please use eFinance.

</495> <496> Why do I have an 'advance debt' amount on my Leave and Earnings Statement (LES)? The advance debt line on your LES is an amount given to offset the immediate collection of an overpayment. It is generated by the pay system when an entitlement/allowance is adjusted retroactively. The result is a debt you are required to repay; contact your servicing Finance Office for more details and debt repayment options. For Reservists, an advance debt is only applicable to long tours (30 days or more).
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 70 Sec 70A 70.3 (Overpayment of Pay and Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437406000&usg=AFQjCNEAuMRB3FMC6ev4psMCOCkSiKuFMQ

</496> <497> How can I be reimbursed for my airfare if I purchased my own ticket? It is DoD policy that travelers use an available (Contracted) Commercial Travel Office (CTO) to arrange official transportation. If you choose not to use a CTO to book your airline ticket you will be reimbursed, however, reimbursement will be limited to the cost of a CTO procured airline ticket. Military members who personally procure transportation for transoceanic travel may not be reimbursed if government or government procured transportation is directed.
To receive reimbursement you must provide receipts and claim the airfare in block 18 on your travel voucher DD Form 1351-2 (Travel Voucher or Sub Voucher). To file your settlement travel voucher, please use Defense Travel System (DTS). To file your non-DTS settlement travel voucher, please use eFinance.

</497> <498> How do I request a remission or waiver? You'll need to submit a DD Form 2789 (Waiver/Remission of Indebtedness Application) to file either a remission or a waiver.
If you're filing a remission and claiming financial hardship as a reason to remit the debt, you should also submit an AF Form IMT 2451 (Financial Statement - Remission of Indebtedness).
Please contact your servicing Finance Office for assistance in determining whether a remission or waiver is more appropriate to your circumstances and for assistance in completing the DD Form 2789 (Waiver/Remission of Indebtedness Application) and AF Form IMT 2451 (Financial Statement - Remission of Indebtedness).
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 73 (Remission and Waiver) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437408000&usg=AFQjCNFmFqGjM8yJfVVtKdzW7HZiUCjXhw
Form: AF Form IMT 2451 (Financial Statement - Remission of Indebtedness) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/form/af2451/af2451.xfd&sa=D&ust=1558682437408000&usg=AFQjCNHzzijpRecI_IaFqu1LFGvY7p10bA
Form: DD Form 2789 (Waiver/Remission of Indebtedness Application) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/infomgt/forms/eforms/dd2789.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437408000&usg=AFQjCNFpaHdvqE9moilAoZ7WC_H4-eseVw
</498> <499> Both my military spouse and I were TDY/deployed. Who can claim family separation allowance (FSA)? If you and your military spouse were residing together prior to the separation, but you didn't have any dependents residing with you, only one of you is entitled to FSA-T, for a TDY more than 30 days provided your military spouse does not reside at or near the TDY location nor visit for more than 30 days. If you and your military spouse were residing together with your dependents immediately prior to your TDY, you are both entitled to receive FSA-T, provided your TDY was for more than 30 days To complete your claim for FSA-T, please use eFinance.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270103 D (Family Separation Allowance - Member Married to Member Couples) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437409000&usg=AFQjCNGBP6rZvaiKofMPPiJ69PjL4UG5Fg
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437409000&usg=AFQjCNH9soiq8I1KZR5vQlBAb6aEhz3zHA
</499> <500> Can the number of Temporary Lodging Expense (TLE) days be extended? Under most circumstances the number of TLE days cannot be extended. The number of TLE days may be extended up to 60 days for a PCS to a CONUS PDS for which the Secretaries Concerned have collectively prescribed a temporary increase due for a major disaster or the PDS must experience a sudden increase in number of assigned members. The PDS must be located in a Presidentially-declared disaster area. Authorized location(s) with the effective date are published in the JTR when approved by the collective Secretaries Concerned.
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5434 (Uniformed Members - Temporary Lodging - CONUS Temporary Lodging Expense - TLE) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437409000&usg=AFQjCNFdum2d-a4kpY3beyJnwqTV6R22yw
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5434 (Uniformed Members - Temporary Lodging - CONUS Temporary Lodging Expense - TLE) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437409000&usg=AFQjCNFdum2d-a4kpY3beyJnwqTV6R22yw
</500> <501> Am I eligible for Rest & Recuperation (R&R) leave? Rest and Recuperation (R&R) Leave: Uniformed Members:
Rest and Recuperation (R&R) programs are for members in a designated hostile-fire or imminent-danger pay area when military necessity restricts the annual leave program and the use of ordinary leave The Assistant Secretary of Defense approves R&R programs R&R programs are managed by the unified commanders for their theaters of operation and limited to one per 12-month period for a standard tour, one per tour for a contingency tour, and two per 18-month or more extended tour (must have served 18+ months in the R&R location before taking 2nd R&R leave) The travel time to and from an R&R area is not chargeable leave See JTR Appendix U (Authorized Rest and Recuperation Locations/Destinations) for a list of approved R&R locations Civilian Employees:
An employee is eligible if assigned to a designated location outside the U.S. R&R leave transportations are limited to one per 12 month standard tour, one per tour for a contingency tour, and two per 18-month or more extended tour (must have served 18+ months in the R&R location before taking 2nd R&R leave) The travel time to and from an R&R area is not chargeable leave See JTR Appendix U (Authorized Rest and Recuperation Locations/Destinations) for a list of approved R&R locations Special Rest and Recuperative (Overseas Tour Extension Incentive Program - OTEIP): For uniformed members only OTEIP is non-chargeable leave authorized in lieu of special pay for certain enlisted members who voluntarily extend their tour at designated overseas locations Eligible members agree to extend at a designated overseas location for a period of exactly one year OTEIP Leave Options
Thirty-days non-chargeable leave Fifteen-days non-chargeable leave and round-trip transportation at Government expense for the military member only. This applies to travel from the designated overseas location to the nearest CONUS port and return. Dependents are not authorized travel under this incentive. You will forfeit your leave options if not used within 12 months after entering the extension Check with your personnel office to determine your eligibility for OTEIP
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec G 14.9 (Rest and Recuperation (R&R)) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437410000&usg=AFQjCNFYbZrvVe4lr3dM9gQGpRmp49pOUg
Regulation: JTR Appendix U (Authorized Rest and Recuperation Locations/Destinations) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437410000&usg=AFQjCNF2zUBLPIyPFGu5eVZb2kE0sEESKA

Regulation: JTR Chap 7 Part A Para 7005 (Funded Rest and Recuperation (R&R) Leave) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437410000&usg=AFQjCNF2zUBLPIyPFGu5eVZb2kE0sEESKA
</501> <502> How many Privately Owned Vehicles (POVs) can I be reimbursed for? As long as you have dependents that are authorized to drive, you are automatically authorized to be reimbursed for up to two POVs. Reimbursement of more than two POVs may be authorized in your PCS order or by a statement from the order approving official for PCS, separation, or retirement travel under the circumstances: More than eight family members travel together by POV, including the member Because of age or physical condition, a dependent needs special accommodations in one vehicle and second and third vehicles are required for more than five other family members A member must report to a new duty station in advance of travel by dependents who delay travel for acceptable reasons (such as school term completion, property sale, settlement of personal business affairs, HHG transportation, non-availability of adequate housing at the new duty station) and more than four dependents travel by POV later More than four dependents travel unaccompanied by POV between authorized points other than those for the member's travel (such as travel to/from a designated place without the member or to the new PDS when the member has TDY en route More than four dependents travel unaccompanied to the new duty station in advance of the member's reporting date for acceptable reasons (such as to enroll children in school at the beginning of the term or secure housing) More than six family members travel together by POV, including the member, over the Alcan Highway (safety guidelines require extra spare tires, parts, tools, etc.) Special circumstances not included in listed above must be approved by Air Force Personnel Center (AFPC).
Regulation: JTR Chap 5_Part_A_Sec_4 (Uniformed Members - POC Use on Permanent Duty Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437410000&usg=AFQjCNF2zUBLPIyPFGu5eVZb2kE0sEESKA
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 5 Sec 5A 5.15 (Use of More Then Two Privately Owned Conveyance (POC) for PCS, Separation/Retirement Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437411000&usg=AFQjCNFaSO74Nx8cHrZG0AgeYriHMhF31A

Regulation: JTR Chap 5_Part_B_Sec_4 (Civilian Employees - POC Use on Permanent Duty Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437411000&usg=AFQjCNEOcl6aX-TuUSEj2FWqJhJUJ9EhIw
</502> <503> How do I get with-dependent rate overseas Cost of Living Allowance (COLA)? With-dependent rate COLA is based on the number of command-sponsored dependents that accompany you at your permanent duty station (PDS).
To access a COLA query, see OCONUS COLA Rates
Log on to virtual Military Personnel Flight (vMPF) for questions related to command sponsorship. To make changes to your COLA, please use eFinance. Reservists - To update your COLA, please visit your servicing Finance Office.

</503> <504> Do I need receipts to receive Cost of Living Allowance (COLA)? Normally no. Receipts are only required if you are claiming an expense for COLA unique expenses. COLA unique expenses reimbursement is limited to a few locations and for specific mandatory OCONUS expenses incurred as a result of a relocation.
Regulation: $JTR_Appendix_J_Part_II
Regulation: $JTR_Appendix_J_Part_II
</504> <505> How do I change my address for my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP)? To update/change your email address use the Thrift Savings Plan Website. To update/change your mailing address use the myPay website.
Related Link: myPay https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mypay.dfas.mil/mypay.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437412000&usg=AFQjCNGCXOQLh8O0FwZ0_Ba0djn0NQmVFg

</505> <506> How do I pick up or deliver my vehicle to and from the Vehicle Processing Center (VPC)? Contact the Vehicle Processing Center (VPC) where your car is or will be located. Visit your local Traffic Management Office (TMO) for further assistance. See the SDDC Website and "Shipping your POV" for other requirements related to transporting a POV.
Related link: SDDC Website https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.sddc.army.mil/&sa=D&ust=1558682437412000&usg=AFQjCNGGeYChjpg1RHRFjfkf7aIHCj9zQg
</506> <507> How often can I claim privately owned vehicle (POV) storage reimbursement? You can claim reimbursement for POV storage on a monthly basis, after the fact. You must provide a copy of your PCS/contingency TDY order and a copy of your paid storage receipt to your servicing Finance Office.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8D 8.32 (Claim Procedures and Authority for Storage of Privately Owned Vehicle) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437412000&usg=AFQjCNGrsupxHF2FrLyclFe17rpQXNm4uQ
</507> <508> How is Dislocation Allowance (DLA) determined? Factors that determine DLA: DLA is determined by your rank and whether or not you have dependents (regardless of the number of dependents). With Dependent Rate/Without Dependent Rate: In order to receive the "with-dependent" rate, your dependents must relocate. If you do not have dependents or if they do not relocate, you will receive the "without-dependent" rate. If you are E-4 or below and are not assigned government quarters, then you must have a signed statement by your Commander or designee stating that you were not assigned permanent government quarters. Ineligibility for DLA: If this is your final move due to separation or retirement, or you are single and resided in government quarters for more than 60 days after your arrival at your new PDS, then you are ineligible to receive DLA.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8C (Dislocation Allowance) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437413000&usg=AFQjCNEotDgGrgq9P3xbuKkzXiv95S9bpg
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5448 (Uniformed Members - DLA - Determining Amount Payable) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437413000&usg=AFQjCNHTTO-kr0SzzgDt8uVVo1jvqG75WA

</508> <509> How many days of Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA) am I authorized? Normally, you are authorized 60 days TLA upon arrival at your OCONUS PDS and 10 days TLA upon departure from your OCONUS PDS. TLA is usually paid in increments of 15 days or fewer, and your TLA days do not have to be consecutive. There are some exceptions for which TLA of more than 60 days upon arrival or 10 days upon departure can be authorized. You can review the exceptions in the JTR links below.

</509> <510> How does commute status affect my TDY allowances at my PDS? If commute status is checked on your AF Form IMT 938 (Request and Authorization for Active Duty Training/Active Duty Tour), you are only authorized one round trip between your home and duty location based upon actual mileage. If you reside outside the local established commuting area and you choose to commute daily between your home and duty location you are limited to one round trip between your home and duty location based upon Defense Table of Official Distance (DTOD).
Regulation: JTR Chap 7 Part K Para 7355 (Uniformed Members - Reserve Component Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437414000&usg=AFQjCNH8b9Yk1arZ5vDqYkz2La29rjwWSw

</510> <511> Can I be reimbursed for the Household Goods (HHG) I had to mail? Yes, HHG mailing fees are reimbursable. However, the Traffic Management Office (TMO) must first approve the weight/expense and verify that it does not exceed your authorized HHG weight. TMO will then provide you with a letter to submit to your Finance Office along with your receipts.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8E 8.33 (Reimbursement for Personally Procured Transportation) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437414000&usg=AFQjCNEFSd7EwZ30GwRft-udGi8WmhyNpw

</511> <512> Will I receive Basic Allowance for Subsistence (BAS), Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH), Overseas Housing Allowance (OHA), and Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) while I receive Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA)? Yes, you will continue to receive all your authorized allowances while receiving TLA. The only exception may be OHA, as OHA starts and stops effective the date of your lease/rental/mortgage agreement.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_9_Part_C_Para9150AN4
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_9_Part_C_Para9150AN4
</512> <513> What mileage rate do I get for Privately Owned Vehicles (POV) pick up/drop off? Uniformed Members: If the POV pick up/ drop off is concurrent with a PCS, then you receive the PCS MALT rate (currently $0.23), plus applicable per diem. If it is not concurrent with a PCS or is for a separate trip, then you receive the TDY mileage rate (currently $0.575). Civilian Employees: If the POV pick up/ drop off is concurrent with a Permanent Duty Travel (PDT), then you receive the PCS MALT rate (currently $0.23), plus applicable per diem. If it is not concurrent with PDT, then you receive the applicable PCS MALT (currently $0.23) rate for one-way travel for the official distance traveled.

</513> <514> How do I update my allotments for retirement? You can visit the myPay website to change, stop, and start an allotment.
