Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 5 Sec 5B (Dependent Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437520000&usg=AFQjCNFNLfuTBwgB6KOrq8dDALSnm9bS8w

</740> <741> If my spouse/dependent decides to move to another location while I am on a remote assignment, what Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) rate will I receive? Your Housing Allowance will be based on whether your dependents move at government expense or not. For moves made at personal expense: If your dependents relocate from a U.S. location to another U.S. location, BAH continues at the rate for the previous U.S. location If your dependents relocate from a U.S. location to an OHA authorized area, you will receive OHA based on the dependents new location If your dependents relocate from an OHA area to a U.S. location, you will receive BAH based on the dependents new location If your dependents relocate from an OHA area to another OHA area, you will receive OHA based on the dependents new location For moves made at government expense: If your dependents relocate from a U.S. location to another U.S. location, you will receive BAH based on the dependents new location If your dependents relocate from a U.S. location to an OHA authorized area, you will receive OHA based on the dependents new location If your dependents relocate from an OHA area to a U.S. location, you will receive BAH based on the dependents new location If your dependents relocate from an OHA area to another OHA area, you will receive OHA based on the dependents new location
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartEPara10408B
</741> <742> How soon can I get a travel advance before I leave for a TDY or PCS? When a travel advance is authorized, the payment for TDY is made no earlier than three workdays prior to departure and for PCS no earlier than ten workdays prior to your departure. If you have a Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) you must obtain advances using an ATM machine.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.2 (Advances - DoD Standard Travel Advance Policy) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437521000&usg=AFQjCNFkysiJzCS5daW3W13HqCJ1VANPYA
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.8 (Advances - Time of Payment) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437521000&usg=AFQjCNFkysiJzCS5daW3W13HqCJ1VANPYA
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.8 (Advances - Time of Payment) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437521000&usg=AFQjCNFkysiJzCS5daW3W13HqCJ1VANPYA
</742> <743> Will I get reimbursed if someone else dropped off / picked up my vehicle Yes, you will need to file a claim and you will be limited to round trip mileage from the Base to the Vehicle Processing Center (VPC).
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 5 Sec 5D 5.26.2 (Transportation of Privately Owned Motor Vehicle (POV) - Non-Concurrent) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437521000&usg=AFQjCNFkysiJzCS5daW3W13HqCJ1VANPYA
</743> <744> How do I request a Family Separation Allowance - Restricted (FSA-R) waiver? If the separation is enforced due to circumstances beyond your control (for example, a specific medical condition that can't be handled at your PDS), then you may be eligible for an FSA-R waiver. Please see the Finance Office for additional information.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270301B (FSA - Waiver Provision) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437522000&usg=AFQjCNGe-J4TXUI8pLMapJXb_v3qy7EClA
</744> <745> Why do I have to recertify my Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH)? The law requires everyone who receives BAH on behalf of their dependents, to submit a certification to the Finance Office. The certification is completed by filling out an AF Form 594 (Application and Authorization to start, stop or change BAQ or Dependency Re-determination). The certification must indicate the status of each dependent to the military sponsor. You are required to review and recertify information concerning your allowance to BAH at PCS arrival, every four years (for those who have not completed a PCS in that period of time), and within 60 days prior to separation or retirement. To recertify your BAH in conjunction with PCS, please use PCS In-Processing System (PIPS). Otherwise, please use eFinance to recertify your BAH.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 32.1 (Entitlement Re-Certification Description) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437522000&usg=AFQjCNHSACJcAZGpZvju8hSuwFgcAI6EzA
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_BPara10100C
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437522000&usg=AFQjCNGvtfWRmc8YhlgsO4KOeP6l8hFP-Q
Related Link: PCS In-Processing System (PIPS) https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437522000&usg=AFQjCNGvtfWRmc8YhlgsO4KOeP6l8hFP-Q
</745> <746> What does the money deducted from my cadet pay cover? The money deducted from your paycheck pays for taxes, Medicare, social security, life insurance, personal services (i.e. barber, dry cleaning, laundry, linen, tailor), advance pay, uniforms, computer maintenance, software license, annual fees, and optional charges.
Related Link: USAF Academy Financial Management CoP https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/afknprod/community/views/home.aspx?Filter%3DFA-FM-XH-01&sa=D&ust=1558682437522000&usg=AFQjCNGrfj3HWbUQpdaeWbtxgOUQjKAQyQ
</746> <747> If I have a Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC), then can I get a TDY advance? Generally, you cannot get a TDY advance off your TDY orders. You can obtain a cash advance from an ATM with your GTCC, but not earlier than 3 duty days before your first scheduled travel day. If you do not have a GTCC, or your TDY location will not allow GTCC use, then you may go to your Finance Office and request an advance paid by Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT). You will be required to supply your travel order with the advance authorized on it or an authorization letter for the amount requested. The authorization letter must be signed by your Commander or First Sergeant. Please use eFinance to process your travel advance request.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.2 (Advances - DoD Standard Travel Advance Policy) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437523000&usg=AFQjCNGoNsXyGOO2hqwXaWicLSZGy7H5NQ
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437523000&usg=AFQjCNFxFVR6tA7i7pUSRFOxgG5eHmkYYQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 5 Para 0504 (Travel Advances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437523000&usg=AFQjCNFud4D82d42B64w780FZSOem8aVdA
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437523000&usg=AFQjCNFxFVR6tA7i7pUSRFOxgG5eHmkYYQ
</747> <748> What am I allowed to receive for my TDY travel advance? You are generally allowed to receive 80 percent of your per diem, lodging, transportation costs and other out of pocket expenses as well as 100 percent of any registration fees three duty days before departure. If the 80 percent limitation will cause undue hardship, then you can request approval from your orders approving official for the additional 20 percent. A TDY travel advance is only authorized if you are exempted from having a Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC). The advance will be paid by Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT). Reference the DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 (DoD Government Travel Charge Card) for further guidance.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.5 (Advances - How to Compute Advances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437523000&usg=AFQjCNGoNsXyGOO2hqwXaWicLSZGy7H5NQ

</748> <749> After I retire, do I still have access to myPay? Yes. After you retire, you will continue to have access to myPay. Your user name and password will remain the same and a new myPay interface, titled "Your Military Retiree Pay Account", will be added to your myPay main menu.

</749> <750> How will I be notified of my remission/waiver decision? Written notification (via email or letter) will be provided to you and to your servicing Finance Office.

</750> <751> How is my leave charged? Your leave is charged based on your status when you depart on leave and your status when you return off leave. Simply put, if you depart on leave on a non-duty day (the weekend for most), the day you depart on leave is chargeable and if you return off of leave on a non-duty day, the day you return is not chargeable. NOTE: This is a recent change of Air Force policy, which is directly opposite of what was the previous policy was for chargeable leave. It does not change the number of days chargeable, just the way leave days are charged.
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec C 6.1.10 (Leave or Duty Status) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437525000&usg=AFQjCNHlEsinMS6QYX-R6zuY_ULz4j4Fdw
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec C 6.1.10 (Leave or Duty Status) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437525000&usg=AFQjCNHlEsinMS6QYX-R6zuY_ULz4j4Fdw
</751> <752> If I have a Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC), may I get a PCS travel advance? No. You are required to use your Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) for all authorized expenses relating to official government travel, including TDY and PCS expenses. If you are exempt from the GTCC, you may receive up to 100 percent of authorized and allowable PCS allowances. You may apply for your PCS travel advance within ten days of your departure. The advance will be paid by Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT). For Reservists, the same PCS advance rules apply.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 Para 030501 (Use of the GTCC for official government travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437525000&usg=AFQjCNGu6pTL-T8Wq1kRg7q45F_zNZ0JjQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 Para 030501 (Use of the GTCC for official government travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437525000&usg=AFQjCNGu6pTL-T8Wq1kRg7q45F_zNZ0JjQ
</752> <753> What is the authority for the Finance Office to charge my pay account? Upon entering the Academy and taking their oath, cadets execute a Power of Attorney (POA) designating the Superintendent, or an appropriate designee (USAFA Finance Office, Cadet Pay), as their attorney and agent with full power to receive and disburse their cadet pay and allowances.
Related Link: USAF Academy Financial Management CoP https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/afknprod/community/views/home.aspx?Filter%3DFA-FM-XH-01&sa=D&ust=1558682437525000&usg=AFQjCNHOrMwcXy-xd-QOfWOZjCTUmUiF9A
</753> <754> Why did I only get 75% per diem on my first and last travel day? The day of departure and return to the Permanent Duty Station (PDS) are paid at 75% regardless of the time of departure or return.

</754> <755> How much is disability severance pay? Disability severance pay is computed by multiplying two months of basic pay times years in service. For more detailed information concerning disability severance pay, contact your servicing Personnel Office.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 35 Para 3504 (Nondisability Separation Pay - Limitations of Eligibility https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437526000&usg=AFQjCNGip-8DkJ9Glg7KSG-P6vthh49Gfg

</755> <756> How do I request a Student Loan Repayment Program W-2? Student Loan Repayment Program W-2s can be obtained by accessing the myPay system. The myPay system currently holds 5 years' worth of W-2 statements.
Related Link: myPay https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mypay.dfas.mil/mypay.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437526000&usg=AFQjCNFCqdu5t7dvKy4jBJEEkZfgDhxm1g

</756> <757> Both my spouse and I are in the military, are we both authorized to receive Temporary Loding Allowance (TLA)? Yes, you both may be authorized to TLA, assuming that you are both stationed OCONUS. Regardless of dependency allowance, you should both submit a TLA claim and equally divide the daily lodging cost, including taxes. For example, if your total lodging cost was $120 per night for ten nights, you and your spouse would each claim $60 per night for ten nights.
Regulation: JTR Chap 9 Part C Para 9185 (TLA - Rates Payable, Computation Procedures, and Examples) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437527000&usg=AFQjCNHaH39aI3diXNhLQi2SDVfXy2KdLQ
</757> <758> Why was my leave balance reduced if I took emergency leave? Emergency leave, leave granted for personal or family emergencies involving the immediate family, is chargeable. Hence, your leave balance was reduced.
Regulation (Active Duty Only): AFI 36-3003 Sec C 6.5 (Emergency Leave) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437527000&usg=AFQjCNFMYpxWhheZtO7q8l6J27nhBQ9DmA

</758> <759> Once I appeal the validity of a debt, what happens to my appeal? When you appeal the validity of a debt, your appeal is submitted to the specific agency (office) that initiated the debt. Your appeal will be processed as expeditiously as possible by the reviewing agency; however, a definitive time line cannot be given. Once your appeal is adjudicated by appropriate agency, you will be notified in writing of the final determination. While your debt is under appeal, no monthly deduction will be collected from your pay, until a final determination is made.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 69.20 (Indebtedness - Appeal) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437527000&usg=AFQjCNHbH_fga2cyEotj_n-q0XueY6798Q
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 69.20 (Indebtedness - Appeal) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437528000&usg=AFQjCNEqQWbjdDMgPDbRABlljQ9d3zdqPw
</759> <760> If I marry enroute, will my spouse be authorized reimbursement? Uniformed Members: It depends on the effective date of your PCS orders. The effective date of orders is your arrival date at your new PDS minus your authorized travel days plus one day. If you were married prior to that date you would be authorized dependent travel. You will need to have your PCS orders amended to include the new dependent. If you were married after that date there would be no allowance for dependent travel. You can file your PCS voucher by clicking on the PIPS link below. Civilian Employees: You are authorized dependent travel allowances for Permanent Duty Travel (PDT) if you acquire dependents prior to/at the time you report for duty at your new PDS. Dependent travel authorization must be included on your travel orders.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8A (Military Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437528000&usg=AFQjCNFS9oHxt2NRMSoEuu5NpLFdXGiluA

Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5088 (Uniformed Members - Factors Affecting Dependent Travel) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437528000&usg=AFQjCNGQ_9G4nfHPihmti0DMlVb1bcWjKA
</760> <761> When will my W-2 be available on myPay? Your W-2 will be available on myPay no later than January 31 of a given year. The myPay home page will contain information on specific dates of availability of W-2s.

</761> <762> My privately owned vehicle (POV) did not arrive on time, am I authorized a rental car during the delay? Uniformed Members: Yes, if your vehicle was transported at Government expense for your use and does not arrive by the designated delivery date, you will be authorized reimbursement for a rental car at a rate not to exceed $30.00 per day for seven days or when the vehicle is made available, whichever occurs first. Civilian Employees: No, there is no authority for rental car reimbursement while awaiting POV arrival.
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5358 (Uniformed Members - Rental Vehicle Reimbursement When POV Transported at Gov't Expense Arrives Late) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437529000&usg=AFQjCNH3z93GtwzmqZwXdewqyQJAxhYdwg
Regulation: JTR Chap 5 Part B Para 5730 (Civilian Personnel - Rental Vehicle Reimbursement When POV Transported at Gov't Expense Arrives Late) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437529000&usg=AFQjCNH3z93GtwzmqZwXdewqyQJAxhYdwg
</762> <763> Do I file my claim for a personally procured move (PPM, formerly DITY) at the Traffic Management Office (TMO) or the Finance Office? Uniformed Members: You will file your claim at the Traffic Management Office (TMO) of your new PDS. TMO will compute and forward your claim to the Finance Office. The Finance Office will then forward your claim to the AFFSC for payment. Civilian Employees: Refer to your PCS orders for HHG transportation information. Contact your servicing Personal Property Shipping Office (i.e. TMO) for additional information on reimbursement steps.
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 8 Sec 8E 8.35.2 (Personally Procured Move for Moving Personal Property - Payment Procedures - Advances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437529000&usg=AFQjCNFng6DktSY8rxWW8Cwhu2AGegHQ4w

</764> <765> Can I be reimbursed Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA) if I stay with friends or family? Yes, if you stay with friends or family, you do not incur any lodging costs and may be reimbursed only the meals and incidental expenses (M & IE) portion of TLA. Money given to friends or family to help offset the additional cost of your stay cannot be claimed as a lodging cost.
Regulation: JTR Chap 9 Part C Para 9150 (TLA - General) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/travelreg.cfm&sa=D&ust=1558682437530000&usg=AFQjCNGb4ALcglxLmDTH3Hcyhr6Jtu3Vmw
</765> <766> How do I file for damages when picking up my Privately Owned Vehicle (POV)? You will have the opportunity to report damages to your vehicle during your final inspection at the Vehicle Processing Center (VPC). Carefully and completely list any losses and all damages to your POV on your DD Form 788 (Vehicle Shipping Document), or commercial equivalent. Carefully inspect the exterior and interior to determine if there are new damages. Also, confirm that items left in the POV at the origin terminal are still there. List all losses and damages discovered and why it was not discovered during the final inspection at the pickup point. Failure to perform this task may result in no payment for this damage. For additional information, contact your local Transportation Management Office (TMO).
Form: DD Form 788 (Vehicle Shipping Document) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/infomgt/forms/eforms/dd0788.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437531000&usg=AFQjCNE9Vm0-sKlh1JclYwN-McL2vmlhqA
</766> <767> What changes in my pay as a result of my promotion/demotion? Any item of pay or allowance based on your grade will change as a result of your promotion or demotion. This includes basic pay, basic allowance for housing (BAH), cost of living allowance (COLA), and overseas housing allowance (OHA). Some pay items such as hostile fire/imminent danger pay (HF/IDP) and certain allowances such as basic allowance for subsistence (BAS) and family separation allowance (FSA) are not based on grade and will not change as a result of your promotion or demotion. Your taxes will also be affected by changes in your taxable income, such as basic pay, as a result of your promotion/demotion.
noref

</770> <771> I just completed Inactive Duty Training (IDT)/Unit Training Assembly (UTA). Why was I paid only Points? The pay system will default to "points only" once you have reached your maximum periods which are authorized for pay. You are authorized a maximum of 24 or 48 drills, depending on your reserve category, for pay in a fiscal year. Some IMA categories are required to work a maximum of 24 drills. If you wish to receive more points towards retirement, then you may perform IDT/UTA without pay and receive points only. Contact your Commander's Support Staff (CSS) for approval of points without pay duty.

</774> <775> Is my disability severance / separation pay taxed? Yes, your disability severance /separation pay will be taxed at the one-time payment taxable rate (currently 25%). This rate is periodically updated by the IRS. If applicable, state income tax will also be withheld from your payment, using the one-time rate for your state of legal residence.

</775> <776> What effect will a bonus recoupment have on my taxes? Provided your bonus was taxable to begin with (i.e. not subject to combat zone tax exclusion - CZTE), your current month taxable wages will be reduced by the amount of collection in the current month. Keep in mind, a bonus recoupment is based off your gross bonus, before taxes are deducted. Since your current income is reduced for a bonus recoupment, your overall taxable wages for the year will also be reduced, which may lower your tax liability for the tax year. See a tax professional for more details.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 Table 44-1 (Rule 5 - Bonus Entitlement) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437534000&usg=AFQjCNFp0cBvYq-UzqkXyo9r4e-Tpr7PAg

</778> <779> As a new reservist when will I start getting paid? As a new reservist, your pay record will be established as a result of data flow from the Military Personnel Data System (MILPDS) to the pay system. Your Reserve Pay Office will have you complete the required in-processing forms. Once your pay record is fully established and all required forms are processed, your pay record will be active, you will start to receive your regular pay and your Leave and Earnings Statements (LES) will be available on myPay.

There is no capability to send your TLA payment directly to your GTCC or any other account.

</780> <781> Can I send a dependent home early? Uniformed Members: Yes, if dependent(s) are command sponsored they may be returned early for the following reasons: Official situations ( JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5098 (Uniformed Members - Early Return of Dependents - Official Situations)) National interest ( JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5100 (Uniformed Members - Early Return of Dependents - National Interest)) Personal situations ( JTR Chap 5 Part A Para 5102 (Uniformed Members - Early Return of Dependents - Personal OCONUS Situations)) Civilian Employees: Early return travel may be authorized when: An employee is eligible for return transportation after completing the PDS service period agreement; or The OCONUS command determines that it is in the GOV’T’s best interest to return the dependent for reasons of a humanitarian/compassionate nature.

Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 (DoD Government Travel Charge Card) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437544000&usg=AFQjCNHR9hHNNDyO_c8aRD4sbcyiTWtNUQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 3 (DoD Government Travel Charge Card) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437544000&usg=AFQjCNHR9hHNNDyO_c8aRD4sbcyiTWtNUQ
</782> <783> What allowances do I get or lose if my dependents leave under early return of dependents (ERD) orders? Uniformed Members: An Early Return of Dependents (ERD) can affect both travel and military pay allowances depending on the reasons your dependents are returning.
The most common changes to your military pay will be Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) and Overseas Housing Allowance (OHA) adjustments. Your COLA will be reduced based on the number of dependents leaving the OCONUS area. If all of your dependents leave, you will receive the single rate of COLA for your grade. Your OHA will also change. Since your dependents will now be at a designated CONUS location, you will be authorized Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) based on their location. You can not receive both BAH and OHA. You may be entitled to a special Family Separation Allowance for Housing-Overseas housing allowance (FSH-O) that is based on the single rate of OHA, provided single-type government quarters are not available.
Your dependents will generally be authorized PCS travel allowances from the OCONUS PDS to a designated place in the CONUS. Household Goods shipment may be authorized as well.
Your specific circumstances determine your actual allowances. See the regulations below for more detailed information. Civilian Employees: Once dependents travel on ERD orders certain limitations apply A dependent’s early return travel must not be authorized more than once during each agreed period of OCONUS service. A dependent’s return travel at GOV’T expense to the OCONUS PDS is not authorized except when incident to the employee’s Renewal Agreement Travel (RAT). A dependent’s early return transportation expenses to the OCONUS PDS are reimbursable when an employee:
Completes an agreed to period of service, Has received unaccompanied one-way dependent transportation to the actual residence, and Has RAT at a later date. Reimbursement must not exceed the GOV’T's cost for the usual transportation mode and route that would have been used had the dependent traveled back to the OCONUS PDS with the employee.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 26.28 (FHS-O and FSH-B) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437544000&usg=AFQjCNGrUbut_9HNVV_vxoX3gd2B7_SnCA
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_APara10016
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10PartEPara10402B2b
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartEPara10410
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10PartAPara10002B3
</783> <784> If my initial claim is denied, do I have any other recourse? If your initial claim is denied, and you are not satisfied with that determination, you may appeal that decision to the claims group at the Defense Office of Hearings and Appeals (DOHA). Within 30 days of the initial determination, submit your appeal to the agency that initially reviewed your claim. That office will submit your appeal to the DOHA for review. In your appeal, you must include your mailing address, telephone, and the amount claimed on appeal. Also identify why the agency was wrong to deny all or part of your claim and attach any relevant documents to your appeal. For additional information on preparing your appeal, refer to DoD Instruction 1340.21, Enclosure 7, at the link below.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 74.1.8 (Claims - Appeal) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437545000&usg=AFQjCNHC2vVe-Sq3_bmfzalQd6JGjHglgA
Regulation: DODI 1340.21, Enclosure 7 (Appeals) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/corres/pdf/134021p.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437545000&usg=AFQjCNFvxA7-lDcO0Cnu2p_X8H_bR7L5nw
</784> <785> When I am between stations, what rate of Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) do I receive? You will continue to receive your current rate of BAH until you sign into you new permanent duty station (PDS), unless you are traveling: From an OCONUS location to a CONUS location From an OCONUS location to another OCONUS location From technical training school to your first PDS From the Air Force Academy, just after graduation, to your first PDS For these situations you will be entitled to BAH-Transit (BAH-T or Non-Locality BAH), these rates are based upon your rank and dependency status and can be found at BAH Non-Locality Rates. In the Non-Locality BAH folder select the file for the current year's non-locality BAH rates.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartEPara10416

</785> <786> How do I request/obtain a military W-2, PPM (formerly DITY) W-2, civilian PCS W-2, and/or Health Professional Scholarship Program (HPSP) W-2? Military, PPM, & HPSP W-2s: You can get copies of your military W-2s and PPM W-2s via the myPay system.

</786> <787> What is the difference between tax-deferred and tax-exempt Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) contributions? Tax-exempt contributions are contributions made from pay that you earn while eligible for the Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE). Tax-exempt contributions are not taxed when withdrawn. Tax-deferred contributions are made from your earnings that aren't subject to the CZTE. These contributions are subject to being taxed when you withdraw funds.

</790> <791> How do I correct an error in the contributions to my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) account? If you have an error or discrepancy regarding your TSP withholdings, you must notify your servicing Finance Office within one year of notification of the discrepancy. Since TSP transactions are reflected on your leave and earnings statement (LES), your notification of a discrepancy happens when the transaction either isn't reflected on your LES or is reflected incorrectly. Your Finance Office can determine if you are making a claim to request correction of an agency error or an administrative error. If your Finance Office determines that the discrepancy is due to an agency error, they will assist you in completing a DD Form 2851 (Request to Correct TSP Agency Error) and forward your claim to the Defense Finance and Accounting Service (DFAS).
The following are examples of agency errors for which a claim may be appropriate: You enrolled in TSP and deductions were not withheld, a different percentage amount than the amount you specified was withheld, or the deduction was taken from a different category of pay than what you elected. Your statement from the National Finance Center (NFC) does not properly reflect the amounted contributed to your account. You elected to stop your TSP contributions but the deductions continued beyond the first full pay period after the Finance Office received your form. DFAS will adjudicate the DD Form 2851 (Request to Correct TSP Agency Error) within approximately 30 days of its receipt and notify you and your Finance Office of the results.
Regulation (Active Duty Only): AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 68.15 (Thrift Savings Plan - Claims Procedures) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437548000&usg=AFQjCNE5bUc82U_zB80s6mCM9_U0mRd8hg
Form: DD Form 2851 (Request to Correct TSP Agency Error) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/infomgt/forms/eforms/dd2851.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437548000&usg=AFQjCNEiymrWUIpH2qbpIspA3HXVuQCNJA

</792> <793> If I did not submit my Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA) claim at my last base, can I file it at my new base? Since TLA requires approval from the base Housing Office, every attempt should be made to submit your final TLA claim at your losing base prior to departing. On rare occasions, when the final TLA claim cannot be submitted before your departure, your losing base will need to submit all information required (including the reason the TLA could not be processed prior to your departure) to your gaining base. This will allow your TLA claim to be processed at your new PDS.

</793> <794> When my duty status changes, how long will it take before my pay is back to normal? Generally, your pay will return to normal status within 30 days after your servicing personnel office processes your duty status change returning you to 'Present for Duty'.
noref
noref
</794> <795> What happens if I do not take all of my available leave as terminal leave in conjunction with separation or retirement? Any unused leave will be sold at the time of your separation or retirement, provided: Your discharge is under honorable conditions, and The total amount of leave sold during your military career does not exceed 60 days (including the potential leave to be sold in conjunction with separation/retirement) If you are ineligible for leave sell back, any leave that remains unused at the time of your separation or retirement will be lost.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 35 Para 350101 (Separation Payments - Accrued Leave Pay - General Entitlement) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437549000&usg=AFQjCNFHIPh7U8q3PhDr2WGJjm32gKsrEA
</795> <796> What is my Family Separation Allowance TDY (FSA-T) rate? FSA-T is payable at the rate of $250.00 per month and prorated to $8.33 per day for partial months. For further guidance go to the DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Para 270104.

</796> <797> Why am I still paying taxes when I'm tax exempt? Check your Leave and Earnings Statement (LES) to confirm that federal taxes are being deducted from your pay. If so, and a check of DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 (Withholding of Income Tax) verifies that you are in a designated combat zone, contact your deployed Finance representative. He/she will work with your Finance Office to update your pay account with the combat zone exemption. If you are a commissioned officer and your monthly pay exceeds the maximum exemption, taxes will be withheld on the amount that exceeds the exemption. Your maximum exemption is equal to the sum of the highest rate of enlisted basic pay plus the amount of Hostile Fire Pay/Imminent Danger Pay (HFP/IDP) payable to you during a qualifying month.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 Para 440102 (Wages Not Subject to Withholding of Federal and State Income Tax) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437550000&usg=AFQjCNExpN5UH2Vldok3amtx-quGHb2VxQ

</797> <798> How many days of leave can I carry over from fiscal year to fiscal year? The normal maximum leave carryover allowed is 60 days. However, the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) of 2013 temporarily changed the maximum carryover from 60 days to 75 days. The current leave extension period will end on 30 September 2015. Unless the NDAA is modified, leave in excess of 60 days on 1 October 2015 will be lost.
That means that members who carried forward a leave balance of 75 days on October 1, 2014, will have to use 45 days of leave before 30 September 2015 in order to prevent losing leave (45 days is derived from (a.) 30 days are accrued during the year, and (b.) the 15 days of extra leave). Barring any additional changes to the law or policy on the subject, if your leave balance exceeds 60 days on 1 October 2015, the balance will be reduced, resulting in a new balance of 60 days.
Also, please note, this change does not affect leave accrued under special leave accrual (SLA) for a deployment or similar circumstances.
Regulation: AFI 36-3003 Sec B 4.5 (Fiscal Year-End Leave Balancing) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/af_a1/publication/afi36-3003/afi36-3003.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437550000&usg=AFQjCNEe97SPygRx7k5pn2as4b7UVZkbUw

</799> <800> Why do I only receive 80% of my entitlement on a travel advance? TDY advances are limited to 80% of all authorized and allowable out-of-pocket expenses you expect to incur during your travel. The 80% limitation is to reduce the chances of you having a debt when you return from your TDY. You are authorized to be advanced 100% of any authorized registration fees. To request an advance travel payment, please use eFinance.

</806> <807> What is the minimum TDY length to be eligible for Family Separation Allowance TDY (FSA-T)? </808> <809> How do I make a catch-up 50 contribution to my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) account? If you are age 50 or older at any point during a calendar year, you may contribute to TSP Catch-up 50. Because the annual limit may change, you will need to make a new election each year if you want to make catch-up contributions. </809> <810> When am I entitled to Family Separation Allowance TDY (FSA-T)? You are entitled to FSA-T if you are separated from your dependents on a TDY for more than 30 continuous days. FSA-T starts the date of departure from your PDS and runs through the day prior to your return to your PDS. Entitlement to FSA-T continues to accrue provided your dependents do not reside near the TDY area nor visit for more than 30 days.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 27 Table 27-3 (FSA Commencement Dates) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437555000&usg=AFQjCNFS3LFeNaiZ1uWKkgw6ogGz14d_rg

</810> <811> Half of my allotment came out of my mid-month pay, but the bank didn't receive it. Why? DFAS only disburses allotments once per month. Although funds are withheld from your pay twice per month, the disbursement to the bank or receiving institution takes place at the end of the month (paid on the 1st of the following month). The allotment is collected evenly from both pay periods to minimize fluctuations in the amount of pay you receive. For example, if you have an allotment of $100 per month to a bank, then your two paychecks for the month will each show a deduction of $50. After the second $50 is deducted from your end of month paycheck (for a total monthly deduction of $100), the full $100 payment is made to the bank on the 1st of the following month. Most allotments can be set up through myPay. Home Mortgage and Insurance allotments must be completed through eFinance or at your servicing Finance Office.
Related Link: eFinance https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.my.af.mil/efinanceprod&sa=D&ust=1558682437555000&usg=AFQjCNHHo-wnVI9CwEkWhjAVJnWmhQP87Q
Related Link: myPay https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mypay.dfas.mil/mypay.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437556000&usg=AFQjCNEUIDqO2gZL62o9y4o9azYsCA0vBw
</811> <812> What is the allotments process? Allotments allow you to send money to a financial institution directly from your paycheck. Each month, half of the allotment amount is deducted from your mid-month paycheck and the other half from your end of month paycheck. The system pays out the total allotment amount to the financial institution on the first day of the following month. You may have up to 15 allotments at one single time, with up to 6 of these being discretionary. Discretionary allotments include allotments for dependent support, savings, insurance and home mortgage payments. Non-discretionary allotments include allotments for the purchase of U.S. savings bonds through the Treasury Direct Website. Most discretionary allotments can be set up through myPay and are disbursed via electronic funds transfer (EFT) to your financial institution. Home Mortgage and Insurance allotments must be completed through eFinance or at your servicing Finance Office.

Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 40 Para 400303 (Non-Discretionary Allotments) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437556000&usg=AFQjCNFKyBkRu7IMgSVyw2VIsJ8pShZF_g

</812> <813> If we are already in the current month, can I stop my allotment so that it does not apply to my Leave and Earnings Statement (LES) for this month? Yes, stops may be effective either at the end of the prior processing month or at the end of the current processing month. However, if you wish for your allotment to stop in the current month, you must ensure it is stopped prior to the end of month cutoff. End of month cutoff varies slightly but usually falls around the 20th of each month. Most allotments can be stopped through myPay. Home mortgage, privatized housing or insurance allotments must be stopped through eFinance or at your servicing Finance Office. NOTE: Generally, military pay documents received by your Finance Office by the 1st of the month will be reflected in your mid-month pay and documents received after the 1st and before the 16th of the month normally will be reflected in your end-of-month pay.

</813> <814> How do I file my travel voucher for a medical invitational travel order? You will need to complete a DD Form 1351-2 (Travel Voucher or Sub Voucher) and submit it along with orders and applicable supporting transportation documentation to your Finance Office.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 9 Chap 8 Para 080503 (Travel Claims - Nonmedical Attendants) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437558000&usg=AFQjCNFG9bFYpO1jo2swOSahtcQ6g9ISwQ
Form: DD Form 1351-2 (Travel Voucher or Sub Voucher) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/forms/eforms/dd1351-2.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437558000&usg=AFQjCNG6miDS5RTSf7HwqfotHSkt7hf3IA
</814> <815> Why didn't I get reimbursed for my lodging on my voucher? There are multiple reasons why your lodging might not have been reimbursed: You did not submit a lodging receipt with your voucher The lodging receipt you submitted was not itemized with daily charges You did not claim the lodging on your voucher You did not provide a "non-availability" statement or confirmation number from your TDY Billeting Office If you provided all the necessary documentation and still not get reimbursed for your lodging, contact your servicing Finance Office. If you did not provide all the proper documentation, you will need to file a supplemental travel voucher for reimbursement. contact your servicing Finance Office for procedures on filing a supplemental voucher.

</815> <816> Why can't I have multiple allotments going to the same bank? To minimize the cost to the Government in the administration of the allotment system, only one allotment may be sent to an allottee. If you wish to send multiple amounts to the same allottee, or the same financial institution, it is your responsibility to work with the institution to transfer funds between the accounts at the institution. Only one allotment for the total may be established. Most allotments can be set up through myPay. Bond (stop only), Home Mortgage, and Insurance allotments must be completed through eFinance or at your servicing Finance Office.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 57.2.5 (Allotments of Pay - Restriction on Multiple Allotments) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437559000&usg=AFQjCNEavH-4mXTXkj0jEx9ZntOP-1OHFA

</816> <817> As an officer, how do I get reimbursed for my initial military clothing purchase? You need to complete an AF Form 1969 (Officer Uniform Allowance Certificate) and turn in to your servicing Finance Office for posting to your pay account. The AF Form 1969 (Officer Uniform Allowance Certificate) is used to process officer initial and additional officer clothing allowances.

</817> <818> How do I correct an error on my TDY voucher? For non-DTS vouchers, if you have already submitted your travel voucher to the Finance Office, you will need to contact them to either make the necessary voucher corrections or to file a supplemental voucher, depending on your voucher status. For DTS vouchers, file an amended voucher within DTS and submit to your AO for approval.

</818> <819> How much base pay am I entitled to receive when on an Active Duty tour for 29 days or less? The amount of base pay you receive for your tour is equal to 1/30th of the monthly rate times the number of days of active duty for the tour. Your monthly rate of base pay is based on your pay grade and years of service. For a current list of basic pay amounts, refer to the DFAS pay table at DFAS Military Pay Tables.

</819> <820> How much enlisted military clothing allowance am I entitled to receive? There are two rates for the Enlisted clothing allowance - basic and standard. The rate you receive is based on your years of service as follows: On your one year anniversary, you will receive one-half of the basic cash clothing allowance. On your 2nd and 3rd anniversaries, you will receive the full basic cash clothing allowance. On your 4th year anniversary, you will receive the full standard cash clothing allowance. You will continue to receive the full standard allowance every year thereafter while on Active Duty. Click Military Clothing Allowance (Look for Clothing Allowances in current Military Pay Table) to view current rates (click on current Military Pay Table). Clothing allowance rates are changed annually on the 1st of October. The new rates will be paid to enlisted members annually on the 1st of the month paycheck following the anniversary month of your enlistment. Current rates can be found in DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 29 Table 29-4 (Cash Clothing Replacement Allowances).
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 29 Para 2903 (Cash Clothing Replacement Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437562000&usg=AFQjCNEqQiarPbsvlKQ1iAWsKQ1rdY8KtQ

</820> <821> Is the leave I sell back taxable? Yes, when you sell back leave, it is considered part of your basic pay and is therefore taxable income. Federal tax withholding is calculated at 25% of your total entitlement; in addition, most states withhold income tax at a one-time rate. If part of the leave sold is combat zone exempt leave (leave earned while eligible for Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE)), that leave will not be taxed for enlisted members (for rules regarding taxing for Officers see DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 35 Para 350103.B.2. (Leave Payments and Taxability - Value Limitation for Officers)).

Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 35 Para 350103.B.2. (Leave Payments and Taxability - Value Limitation for Officers) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437562000&usg=AFQjCNEqQiarPbsvlKQ1iAWsKQ1rdY8KtQ
</821> <822> When do I receive the full rate of standard cash clothing replacement allowance? Active enlisted personnel only: You will begin to receive the full standard clothing replacement allowance after you complete 36 months of service, to be paid upon your 4th anniversary date of enlistment. While enlisted, you will continue to receive the full rate every year thereafter on the 1st paycheck following your anniversary month.

</822> <823> Can I contribute a lump sum to my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) account? With one exception, you must make all TSP contributions by payroll deduction, including contributions of any special, incentive and bonus payments that you designate. You must be actively contributing from your basic pay in order to contribute from any other pays or bonuses. The exception to contribution by payroll deduction occurs if your TSP form is not processed in a timely manner, in which case you may be able to write a check for the contribution that was not processed timely.

</823> <824> Can my military spouse and I receive with dependent rate basic allowance for housing (BAH)? Normally, no. The only circumstance in which both spouses can receive the with dependent allowance is if both military people are assigned to a different location and both have custody of a dependent child. In all other situations, one person will receive the with dependent rate while the other receives the without dependent rate of BAH.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartCPara10204C
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartCPara10204C
</824> <825> What are my Consecutive Overseas Tour (COT) / In Place Consecutive Overseas Tour (IPCOT) allowances? For COT, you are authorized regular PCS allowances for the travel between your old duty station and home of record (HOR) or other place (not to exceed HOR), and then on to the next duty station for you and your dependents. For IPCOT or deferred COT leave, you are authorized travel and transportation allowances between your duty station and HOR, or other place (not to exceed HOR), and return to your duty station for you and your dependents.

</825> <826> What is the maximum amount of money that can be taken from my paycheck for forfeiture? Generally, for partial forfeitures, the maximum that may be deducted is two-thirds of the pay subject to forfeiture. Total forfeitures are not subject to the two-thirds rule. Judge Advocate (JA) will furnish the Finance Office with the documentation to process the fine or forfeiture. These documents are prioritized ahead of all other transactions. If your fine or forfeiture has not shown up in your Leave and Earning Statement (LES) there may have been a delay in the paperwork reaching the Finance Office.

</826> <827> I received Civilian Clothing Allowance for my job and am going TDY, may I receive the TDY Civilian Clothing Allowance instead? No, if you receive a Permanent Duty Civilian Clothing Allowance within the preceding 12 months, you cannot receive a TDY Civilian Clothing Allowance.

</827> <828> Can I roll my Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) contributions over into a 401k? Yes, you may. For more details, search the term "rollover" at the Thrift Savings Plan Website.

</828> <829> When will I receive my bonus payment? Active Duty: Generally, your bonus installment should be received on your anniversary date. If your payment is the initial installment, you may have to provide documentation to your Finance Office in order for the payment to be released. If you have done that and still haven't received payment, contact your servicing Finance Office. Reserve: Bonus payments are normally paid on or after the due date for the particular bonus. Please contact your servicing Reserve Payroll Office with additional questions regarding bonus payment time frames.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 12.4 (DFAS Output on Selective Reenlistment Bonuses) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437565000&usg=AFQjCNGFW5mQIlOBggAXiVpY7q4Zmjnw1Q

</829> <830> If I have a break in service, will my clothing allowance start over? If you have less than a three month break in service, your clothing allowance will not restart. It will continue to be paid on your normal anniversary date. If you have more than a three month long break in service, your clothing allowance will start over and a new anniversary date will be established based upon your new active duty entry date. Active Duty: If you have more than a three month long break in service, you are authorized a new, full initial clothing allowance. Reserve: If you have more than a three month long break in service, your clothing allowance will start over, provided that you are going on active duty for more than six months and for a reason other than active duty for training. The amount you are entitled to is the value of the initial clothing allowance at the time you resume service minus the current value of the clothing you had when you commenced your pause in service. For example, if the initial clothing allowance at the time you resume service is $300, and the current value of the clothing you had leftover from when you paused your service is $100, you would be authorized $200. Detailed instructions can be found in the DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 29 Para 290202 (Standard Initial Clothing Allowance - Entitlement Criteria), AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 33 (Clothing Allowances) and AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 15 (Reserve Component: Clothing and Uniform Allowances). See your Personnel office for more information.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 29 (Clothing Monetary Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437565000&usg=AFQjCNHrv_WSDJQi4LEtLittUe0cCyAMmQ
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 29 Table 29-3 (Entitlement to Cash Clothing Replacement Allowances) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437565000&usg=AFQjCNHrv_WSDJQi4LEtLittUe0cCyAMmQ
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 33 Sec 33A 33.3 (Initial Clothing Monetary Allowance for Prior Service Enlisted Members Paid Through DJMS) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437565000&usg=AFQjCNGFW5mQIlOBggAXiVpY7q4Zmjnw1Q
</830> <831> How do I get maternity clothing allowance? Active Duty: Maternity clothing allowance is processed on an AF Form 469, Duty Limiting Condition Report. The AF 469 is initiated at your Military Treatment Facility and must be signed by either your physician or health care practitioner. The form is then presented to your CSS, where your commander or First Sergeant endorses it. Prior to endorsement, your commander or First Sergeant must counsel you on requirements to purchase mandatory uniform items and must place a statement on the AF 469 stating that you have been counseled. After your commander or First Sergeant endorses the AF 469, submit it to your local Finance Office for processing. Once processed, your allowance will flow into your next available paycheck. You may not receive maternity clothing allowance more than once in a three year period. Reserve: Your commander must require and authorize the uniform. When your commander authorizes the maternity uniform, you will be directed to your medical treatment facility where an AF Form 422 will be prepared. You should then take the AF 422 to your local Pay Office, who will add the commander's certification and approve the form. Once the form is approved, your maternity clothing can be issued to you in-kind.
Regulation (Reserve Only): AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 15.2.4.4 (Reserve Component: Pregnant Enlisted Members) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437566000&usg=AFQjCNGyD5f3qEs2HbKpPSOkQQtppdeUsg

</831> <832> Are my dependents authorized travel allowances for Consecutive Overseas Tour (COT) / In Place Consecutive Overseas Tour (IPCOT)? Dependents are authorized travel allowances for COT/IPCOT if all of the following conditions apply: They are dependents on the last day of your first tour at the old OCONUS Duty Station or upon the effective date of your PCS orders to the new OCONUS Duty Station. They are command sponsored for both tours. They are located at or in the vicinity of your old OCONUS Duty Station. They are accompanying you during both tours.

</833> <834> How will my bonus be paid? Generally, your bonus will be a separate deposit and will not be included in your paycheck. However, it will be deposited into the same account as your regular pay.

</834> <835> How much is my reenlistment bonus taxed? Bonus payments are subject to federal and state taxation. Your reenlistment bonus will be taxed at the flat Federal Income Tax Withholding (FITW) rate (currently 25%) plus any State Income Tax Withholding (SITW) rate applicable to the state you claim for tax purposes.
If you reenlisted during a month when you were authorized Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE) then your bonus and future installments will not be taxed. Also, if you had your bonus paid directly to the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP), it will not be taxed until you withdraw the money.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 (Withholding of Income Tax) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437567000&usg=AFQjCNHayDUQNWF-3KAyzCl9vm6b6hnCKQ

</836> <837> As a member without dependents living in government quarters, am I entitled to full Cost of Living Allowance (COLA)? Generally, you will receive Reduced COLA (currently 63% of the full COLA rate for a member with 0 dependents at your Permanent Duty Station (PDS)); however, if you do not have a government dining facility or the commander has designated use of a government dining facility impractical, then you are entitled to full COLA. The full COLA rate will be for a member with 0 dependents for your PDS.

</837> <838> How much can I receive for an emergency payment in between normal pay days? You may receive an emergency payment (referred to a partial or casual payment) in an amount up to your accrued pay and allowances to date minus normal deductions. For example, if you receive a partial/casual payment on the 11th calendar day of the pay period, you will be authorized 11 days of pay minus normal deductions. For Reservists, you must be on a tour of 30 or more days to be eligible for a partial / casual payment.

For Defense Travel System (DTS) debts, you can retrieve a copy of your voucher by logging into DTS and printing out a copy of your paid voucher.

noref
</839> <840> When does my Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) start and stop? Generally, your entitlement to OCONUS COLA begins on the day you arrive at your OCONUS duty station. When you depart PCS, your COLA stops effective the day before your departure. If CONUS COLA is authorized at your CONUS duty station, your entitlement begins effective the day you arrive at your duty station. It stops effective the day before you report to your next duty station, less any travel time.

</841> <842> As a reservist, how do I receive payment for my Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA)? Once you've filed your TLA claim with the local Housing Office and submitted your claim to your servicing Finance Office, you will receive a separate EFT payment into your direct deposit bank account.

</842> <843> Whom do I contact if I have an issue with the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP)? Any questions concerning your TSP should be directed to the Thrift Savings Plan Website or you may call 1-TSP-YOU-FRST (1-877-968-3778) from any of the 50 U.S. States, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, or Canada. International callers who cannot use the toll-free number should call 1 (404) 233-4400 (not toll-free). To change your withholding for TSP, please use myPay. To change the allocation of your contributions between TSP funds, use the Thrift Savings Plan Website. Civilian employees can change their TSP election in the Employee Benefits Information System (EBIS). EBIS can be accessed via the AFPC Secure Apps page. Note: If you have issues logging into EBIS, complete the following steps. 1.) Open Internet Explorer. 2.) Access Tools > Internet Options > Advanced and scroll down to the Security category. Ensure the checkboxes next to "Use SSL 2.0, Use SSL 3.0, and Use TLS 1.0" are all checked. 3.) If you check any of the boxes, be sure to also click on the Content tab and clear the SSL state.

</843> <844> When will my allotment pay out? Your allotment is evenly divided between your semimonthly paychecks. Even though both your mid-month and end-of-month pay are reduced by half the allotted amount, the actual allotment is only disbursed once a month on the 1st.
noref
</844> <845> When will I get paid my first military paycheck, and how will I receive it? Once you are fully accessed (your pay record is established), you will be paid on the 1st and 15th of each month. If there are delays in the establishment of your record, then you may be able to receive partial payments from your servicing local Finance Office until your pay record is fully accessed. Your pay is determined by the length of your service time, tax rates, the number of dependents you have, and numerous other factors. To find out about your specific pay, contact your servicing Finance Office. All payments are made through electronic funds transfer (EFT) to your direct deposit account. You are required to establish direct deposit of your pay to your financial institution as part of accession in-processing. In an emergency situation, your servicing Finance Office may make a local payment for accrued pay and allowances, if your direct deposit has not started yet.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 38.1 (Direct Deposit of Pay - Description) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437570000&usg=AFQjCNG0DmV_dYFuf5uQmPCZj1XWjld3qw
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 39.2 (Accessions) Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 32 Para 320202 Emergency Partial Payments)
</845> <846> I filed my voucher, so why do I still have a balance on my Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC)? There are several possible reasons why you still have a balance on your Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) after the settlement of your voucher, including the following: The amount due to you on your voucher was not sufficient to cover the outstanding GTCC balance You did not specify a split disbursement amount on your voucher You remain obligated to pay the card issuer, even though your reimbursement may be less than anticipated. If you have questions about your travel voucher entitlement, please contact your servicing Finance Office.

For Reservists, you must be on a tour of 30 or more days to be eligible for a partial / casual payment.

</847> <848> What entitlements and rates will I get paid? Your entitlements and rates will depend on many factors, including your grade, your total time in service, your duty location, your dependency status, and your job. When you in-process with Finance, you will be able to verify all of your entitlements. You can find rates for pay and entitlements at the following links below. For additional information, contact your servicing Finance Office. NOTE: If you have no dependents for BAH purposes, you will only receive the without-dependent rate BAH-T (non-locality BAH) when in a travel/leave status between training locations. BAH is not payable to you while at any training location less than 20 weeks. Locality based BAH doesn't start until you report to your first permanent duty station (PDS).

</848> <849> How much Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) am I allowed during an active duty tour that is more than 30 days? If you have been called or ordered to active duty for more than 30 days, you are authorized to receive BAH/OHA per the following: Active duty tours between 31 and 139 days receive BAH/OHA at the primary residence rate Active duty tours of 140 or more days and authorized to ship HHG receive BAH/OHA at the duty location rate Active duty tours of 140 or more days and not authorized to ship HHG receive BAH/OHA at the primary residence rate Active duty tours of 180 or more days FOR OTHER THAN TRAINING and authorized to ship HHG receive BAH/OHA at the duty location rate Active duty tours of 180 or more days FOR OTHER THAN TRAINING and not authorized to ship HHG receive BAH/OHA at the primary residence rate Active duty tours in support of a contingency, regardless of length, are authorized to receive BAH/OHA at the primary residence rate. If you are authorized to ship household goods on the contingency tour, you are authorized BAH/OHA at the duty location rate. Your BAH is determined by your grade, dependency status, and home of record. See BAH Rates to find your current rate . Please contact your servicing Finance Office if you believe you are receiving the incorrect BAH rate.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 3 Chap 14.1 (Reserve Component: BAH Type II - Basic Entitlement) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afman65-116v3/afman65-116v3.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437571000&usg=AFQjCNFFN5uM4lhR7a7eTPoPLjpnsbk4tA
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10PartAPara10002B

</849> <850> How often do I get my accruals? You begin receiving accrual payments 30 days from the first day of the TDY, and every 30 days thereafter until you return to your Permanent Duty Station (PDS). TDY period must be over 45 days for you to file an accrual. An exception to this payment schedule is when airline tickets are charged to your Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC). They may be paid upon your request if the split disbursement option is used, but not earlier than your departure. If you do not receive accrual payments, you can go into virtual MPF and make a request for payment. See AFI 65-114 Chap 9.4.7 (Accrual Payments for TDYs over 45 days) for more information. If the order was established in the Defense Travel System (DTS) and you requested accruals, they are paid automatically every 30 days.

Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.4.7 (Accrual Payments for TDYs over 45 days) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437572000&usg=AFQjCNF0KOdB3CmWFYvKYPZOfdG1Yovnag
Regulation: AFI 65-114 Chap 9.4.7 (Accrual Payments for TDYs over 45 days) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/production/1/saf_fm/publication/afi65-114/afi65-114.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437572000&usg=AFQjCNF0KOdB3CmWFYvKYPZOfdG1Yovnag
</850> <851> What happens to my Family Separation Housing - Overseas housing allowance based location (FSH-O) or Family Separation Housing - Basic allowance for housing based location (FSH-B) if my dependents move to my duty location? If any of your dependents move to your duty location, then FSH-B or FSH-O and any housing allowance received on behalf of your dependents will stop and you will begin receiving with dependent overseas housing allowance (OHA) or basic allowance for housing (BAH) based on your permanent duty station.
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_Part_E_Para10406
Regulation: $JTR_Chap_10_PartEPara10408
</851> <852> How much total per diem am I authorized for PCS travel? You are authorized to 100% of the applicable per diem rate, which includes Meals and Incidental Expenses (M&IE) and Lodging multiplied by the number of actual travel days not to exceed the authorized travel days. Your spouse and each child 12 or over are authorized 75% of your allowance, and each child under 12 is authorized 50% of your allowance. If you drive, the per diem rate is the standard CONUS rate. For other modes of travel, the rate is generally based on the rate for your destination. In such situations, the first and last travel day per diems are also reduced from 100% to 75% of the applicable per diem. You can go to the website below for current per diem rates. You can file your PCS voucher by clicking on the PIPS link below.

</853> <854> How much federal tax and state tax will be taken out of my reenlistment bonus? Bonus payments are subject to federal and state taxation. Your reenlistment bonus will be taxed at the flat Federal Income Tax Withholding (FITW) rate (currently 25%) plus any State Income Tax Withholding (SITW) applicable to the state you claim for tax purposes.
If you reenlisted during a month when you were entitled to Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE) then your bonus and future installments will not be taxed. Also, if you had your bonus paid directly to the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP), it will not be taxed until you withdraw the money.

</854> <855> What are my pay and allowances while in confinement? While in confinement, your pay and allowances will be as such:
1 - Member awaiting trial by court-martial or serving a sentence of confinement which did not include a forfeiture of pay: member is entitled to pay and allowances.
2 - Member serving a court-martial sentence which includes a forfeiture of pay and allowances: member is entitled to pay and allowances before the date the sentence was approved by the convening authority and to any unforfeited pay and allowance accruing after that date.
Also, while you are in confinement status you will not continue to accrue leave.
Regulation: DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 1 (Basic Pay) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://comptroller.defense.gov/fmr.aspx&sa=D&ust=1558682437574000&usg=AFQjCNGh4ySrD7StdkB7Qk1dJPrP8iQdAg
</855> <856> What daily rate will I receive for PCS Travel? If you drive, then the daily per diem rate is the standard CONUS rate. If you fly, the per diem rate is the rate for your destination. Members get 100% of the applicable rate. Your spouse and each child 12 or over receives 75% of the member's allowance. Each child under 12 receives 50% of the member's allowance. You can find per diem rates at the link available below. If a dependent travels non-concurrently from the member, the dependent may be authorized the same per diem rate as the member.

</856> <857> As a prior enlisted member being assessed as an officer, will my allotments, leave, or debt carry over? Any and all allotments you may have previously had will not carry over. You will need to start (restart) all allotments. Your leave might carry over. Whether or not your leave carries over is determined by your commissioning program and your separation program designator. Please contact your servicing Personnel Office for more details about leave carry over and commissioning programs. Your debts could also carry over. If your debts from your previous service are not satisfied prior to your being accessed, then it is possible they could be deducted from current pay. Whether or not your debt carries over and if it will be deducted from your pay varies on a case-by-case basis. Contact your servicing Personnel Office and servicing Finance Office for specific information regarding your situation.
Regulation: AFMAN 65-116 Vol 1 Chap 39.2.3 (Accessions - Input of MMPA Transactions) https://www.google.com/url?q=http://static.e-publishing.af.mil/etc/AFMAN65-116V1.pdf&sa=D&ust=1558682437574000&usg=AFQjCNEnkvlmRu_24SCfwi0ndWXkG23krg
</857> <858> What are the effective dates of my new PCS allowances? Housing Allowances Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) - your new permanent duty station (PDS) BAH rate begins on the day you report for duty at your new PDS. Overseas Housing Allowance (OHA) - payment of OHA begins the day you obtain private sector housing (i.e. effective date of your lease), once you have reported for duty at your new PDS. Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) COLA starts on the day you report for duty at your new PDS. Temporary Lodging Allowance (TLA) You are authorized TLA when occupying temporary lodgings in conjunction with a PCS to an OCONUS PDS. TLA eligibility begins upon initial arrival at your new PDS, while waiting for government quarters assignment, or while completing arrangements for private sector housing when government quarters are not available. Temporary Lodging Expense (TLE) You are authorized TLE when occupying temporary lodgings before leaving your last PDS in the CONUS and/or after arrival at your new CONUS PDS. Based on your individual situation, you are generally authorized one of the following: 10 days for a PCS to a CONUS PDS (you may split the days between old CONUS PDS, new CONUS PDS, and designated place in CONUS), or 5 days for a PCS to an OCONUS PDS (you may split the days between old CONUS PDS and designated place in CONUS)

</858> <859> When will my partial/casual/advance payment be made to my account? Once you submit your partial/casual/advance pay request documentation to your local Finance Office, it takes approximately 2-3 business days to receive the funds via Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT). This payment will be made separately from your normal paycheck. The full amount of your partial, casual, or advance payment will show up on your Leave and Earning Statement (LES) under the deduction column.

</859> <860> How do I request Temporary Quarters Subsistence Allowance (TQSA) or Foreign Transfer Allowance (FTA)? DoD civilians may be authorized TQSA and FTA when transferring to an OCONUS foreign area. These allowances are governed by the Department of State Standardized Regulations, Sections 120 and 240. These allowances consist of: TQSA: Reimbursement for temporary lodgings occupied upon arrival at a foreign OCONUS area PDS or immediately upon departure from that PDS if eligible for a Living Quarters Allowance FTA: Miscellaneous Expense Portion (new appointees only, other employees receive Miscellaneous Expense Allowance) Pre-departure Subsistence Expense (payable for the CONUS/non-foreign OCONUS area only) Lease Penalty Expense Portion TQSA and FTA should be authorized in your PCS orders. To claim your TQSA and FTA, contact your servicing Finance Office. Please contact your servicing Finance Office to resolve any problems you may have with your TQSA or FTA vouchers.

Your meal deductions stop automatically during leave periods. Meal deductions also stop when you're TDY. If your meal deductions did not stop while TDY, please contact your local Finance Office for resolution.

</861> <862> Am I allowed Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) during an Active Duty tour from an OCONUS location that is 31 days or more? If you have been called or ordered to active duty from an OCONUS location for more than 30 days, you are authorized to receive COLA per the following: Active duty tours between 31 and 139 days receive BAH/OHA at the primary residence rate Active duty tours of 140 or more days FOR TRAINING receive COLA at the duty location rate Active duty tours of 180 or more days FOR OTHER THAN TRAINING and authorized to ship HHG receive COLA at the duty location rate Active duty tours of 180 or more days FOR OTHER THAN TRAINING and not authorized to ship HHG receive COLA at the primary residence rate Active duty tours of 30 days or less in support of a contingency are authorized to receive COLA at the primary residence rate. Reference the link below to see a list of authorized locations.

</862> <863> Will my garnishments carry over once I retire? All debts, including garnishments, will be transferred upon your retirement, and collection will be resumed from your retirement pay.

</863> <864> How often can I receive military clothing allowance? Enlisted: your military clothing allowance is paid automatically every year on the 1st of the month paycheck following the anniversary month of your enlistment. On your one year anniversary, you will receive one-half of the basic cash clothing allowance On your second and third anniversaries, you will receive the full basic cash clothing allowance On your fourth year anniversary, you will receive the full standard cash clothing allowance, and will continue to receive the full standard allowance every year thereafter while on active duty Officers: you receive a one-time entitlement upon your entry on active duty.

</864> <865> What expenses does per diem cover for PCS travel? The per diem covers meals, lodging, and incidental expenses. It does not cover transportation expenses such as tolls, mileage, or common carrier tickets.

</865> <866> If my spouse is in the military, or a civilian employee authorized to relocate, who is authorized mileage reimbursement during PCS? PCS mileage or MALT (Monetary Allowance in Lieu of Transportation) reimbursement is limited to either yourself, your military spouse, or your civilian employee spouse when you travel together in one Privately Owned Conveyance (POC).
If two POCs are used, then both you and your military/civilian spouse (or other authorized dependent) are entitled to MALT.

</867> <868> What is the maximum civilian PCS advance for which I am eligible? You are required to maximize the use of the Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) for your move. If you do not have a GTCC, you are eligible to receive an advance for the following allowances, with the noted limitations: Per diem and mileage or other authorized transportation expenses, for you and your dependents, from your old station to your new station. This will be advanced at 100% of the allowance. Per diem and transportation for a house hunting trip. This will be advanced at 100% of the allowance. Temporary Quarters Subsistence Expense (TQSE). This will be advanced at 75% of the estimated allowance to help offset any tax liability for you. Shipment and storage of household goods (HHG). This will also be advanced at 75% of the estimated allowance to help offset any tax liability for you. Movement of a mobile home.

</868> <869> What is Combat Zone Tax Exclusion (CZTE)? The combat zone tax exclusion (CZTE) allows military personnel to exclude from tax liability all or a portion of their pay and entitlements earned while serving in designated combat zones (CZ). A CZ is any area designated by Executive Order as an area in which Armed Forces of the United States are, or have, engaged in combat. The exclusion is applied monthly for any month in which you served in a designated CZ. For enlisted personnel and warrant officers, all pay is exempt from taxes. For officers, the amount excluded from taxes is limited to the sum of the highest rate of enlisted basic pay plus the amount of Hostile Fire Pay/Imminent Danger Pay (HFP/IDP) actually payable to the officer for the qualifying month.
CZTE applies to withholding for both federal and state income tax. However, your basic pay remains subject to withholding for Social Security and Medicare taxes. If you are hospitalized, or rehospitalized, because of a wound, disease or injury that you incurred while serving in a combat zone, your tax free status (CZTE) continues while you are hospitalized. Your exclusion ends when you are discharged from the hospital or changed to outpatient status. If you are rehospitalized due to the same injury you may also qualify for the tax exclusion for up to two years after hostilities have ended. Reference DODFMR Vol 7A Chap 44 Para 440103C7 link below and the Wounded Warrior Handbook, published by DFAS. There are additional support materials on the DFAS Wounded Warrior website.

</869> <870> I filed an accrual last month, why is my Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) overdue? If you did not annotate an amount on the accrual worksheet to be split disbursed to your GTCC, payment to your GTCC will not be made and you will receive the entire accrual payment in your personal bank account. If you did not receive the entire accrual payment in your personal bank account, contact your servicing Finance Office immediately. If you have received payment, you may pay your GTC balance directly. To file an accrual travel voucher, please use Defense Travel System (DTS). To file a non-DTS accrual travel voucher, please use eFinance or vMPF, as applicable. To make a payment on your GTCC, please see the Citibank Website

</870> <871> How do I get paid if my pay record shows I have incorrectly been separated? See your Finance Office to verify that your pay record does in fact categorize you as separated. If it does, then contact your servicing Personnel Office immediately to ensure action is being taken to re-establish your pay account. Depending on your situation, you may be entitled to receive a partial/casual payment until your pay record has been updated. Your Finance Office can provide additional information.
noref
noref
</871> <872> How long does it take to get paid for my PCS voucher once I arrive at my new Permanent Duty Station (PDS)? Uniformed Members: Your PCS settlement voucher should be paid within ten business days of completing your voucher in PCS In-Processing System (PIPS). Civilian Employees: Your PCS settlement voucher should be paid within ten business days of completing your voucher with your servicing Finance Office. NOTE: During the peak PCS season (Jun-Oct), you may experience greater delays due to the volume of vouchers being processed
